2666 //this pops up a dialog which allows the left selection to be set.
2667 //If playing/recording is happening, it sets the left selection at
2668 //the current play position.
2669 void AudacityProject::OnSetLeftSelection()
2670 {
2671  bool bSelChanged = false;
2672  if ((GetAudioIOToken() > 0) && gAudioIO->IsStreamActive(GetAudioIOToken()))
2673  {
2674  double indicator = gAudioIO->GetStreamTime();
2675  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT0(indicator, false);
2676  bSelChanged = true;
2677  }
2678  else
2679  {
2680  wxString fmt = GetSelectionFormat();
2681  TimeDialog dlg(this, _("Set Left Selection Boundary"),
2682  fmt, mRate, mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(), _("Position"));
2683 
2684  if (wxID_OK == dlg.ShowModal())
2685  {
2686  //Get the value from the dialog
2687  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT0(
2688  std::max(0.0, dlg.GetTimeValue()), false);
2689  bSelChanged = true;
2690  }
2691  }
2692 
2693  if (bSelChanged)
2694  {
2695  ModifyState(false);
2696  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
2697  }
2698 }
2699 
2700 
2701 void AudacityProject::OnSetRightSelection()
2702 {
2703  bool bSelChanged = false;
2704  if ((GetAudioIOToken() > 0) && gAudioIO->IsStreamActive(GetAudioIOToken()))
2705  {
2706  double indicator = gAudioIO->GetStreamTime();
2707  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT1(indicator, false);
2708  bSelChanged = true;
2709  }
2710  else
2711  {
2712  wxString fmt = GetSelectionFormat();
2713  TimeDialog dlg(this, _("Set Right Selection Boundary"),
2714  fmt, mRate, mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1(), _("Position"));
2715 
2716  if (wxID_OK == dlg.ShowModal())
2717  {
2718  //Get the value from the dialog
2719  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT1(
2720  std::max(0.0, dlg.GetTimeValue()), false);
2721  bSelChanged = true;
2722  }
2723  }
2724 
2725  if (bSelChanged)
2726  {
2727  ModifyState(false);
2728  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
2729  }
2730 }
2731 
2732 void AudacityProject::NextFrame()
2733 {
2734  switch( GetFocusedFrame() )
2735  {
2736  case TopDockHasFocus:
2737  mTrackPanel->SetFocus();
2738  break;
2739 
2740  case TrackPanelHasFocus:
2741  mToolManager->GetBotDock()->SetFocus();
2742  break;
2743 
2744  case BotDockHasFocus:
2745  mToolManager->GetTopDock()->SetFocus();
2746  break;
2747  }
2748 }
2749 
2750 void AudacityProject::PrevFrame()
2751 {
2752  switch( GetFocusedFrame() )
2753  {
2754  case TopDockHasFocus:
2755  mToolManager->GetBotDock()->SetFocus();
2756  break;
2757 
2758  case TrackPanelHasFocus:
2759  mToolManager->GetTopDock()->SetFocus();
2760  break;
2761 
2762  case BotDockHasFocus:
2763  mTrackPanel->SetFocus();
2764  break;
2765  }
2766 }
2767 
2768 void AudacityProject::NextWindow()
2769 {
2770  wxWindow *w = wxGetTopLevelParent(wxWindow::FindFocus());
2771  const wxWindowList & list = GetChildren();
2772  wxWindowList::compatibility_iterator iter;
2773 
2774  // If the project window has the current focus, start the search with the first child
2775  if (w == this)
2776  {
2777  iter = list.GetFirst();
2778  }
2779  // Otherwise start the search with the current window's next sibling
2780  else
2781  {
2782  // Find the window in this projects children. If the window with the
2783  // focus isn't a child of this project (like when a dialog is created
2784  // without specifying a parent), then we'll get back NULL here.
2785  iter = list.Find(w);
2786  if (iter)
2787  {
2788  iter = iter->GetNext();
2789  }
2790  }
2791 
2792  // Search for the next toplevel window
2793  while (iter)
2794  {
2795  // If it's a toplevel, visible (we have hidden windows) and is enabled,
2796  // then we're done. The IsEnabled() prevents us from moving away from
2797  // a modal dialog because all other toplevel windows will be disabled.
2798  w = iter->GetData();
2799  if (w->IsTopLevel() && w->IsShown() && w->IsEnabled())
2800  {
2801  break;
2802  }
2803 
2804  // Get the next sibling
2805  iter = iter->GetNext();
2806  }
2807 
2808  // Ran out of siblings, so make the current project active
2809  if (!iter && IsEnabled())
2810  {
2811  w = this;
2812  }
2813 
2814  // And make sure it's on top (only for floating windows...project window will not raise)
2815  // (Really only works on Windows)
2816  w->Raise();
2817 }
2818 
2819 void AudacityProject::PrevWindow()
2820 {
2821  wxWindow *w = wxGetTopLevelParent(wxWindow::FindFocus());
2822  const wxWindowList & list = GetChildren();
2823  wxWindowList::compatibility_iterator iter;
2824 
2825  // If the project window has the current focus, start the search with the last child
2826  if (w == this)
2827  {
2828  iter = list.GetLast();
2829  }
2830  // Otherwise start the search with the current window's previous sibling
2831  else
2832  {
2833  if (list.Find(w))
2834  iter = list.Find(w)->GetPrevious();
2835  }
2836 
2837  // Search for the previous toplevel window
2838  while (iter)
2839  {
2840  // If it's a toplevel and is visible (we have come hidden windows), then we're done
2841  w = iter->GetData();
2842  if (w->IsTopLevel() && w->IsShown())
2843  {
2844  break;
2845  }
2846 
2847  // Find the window in this projects children. If the window with the
2848  // focus isn't a child of this project (like when a dialog is created
2849  // without specifying a parent), then we'll get back NULL here.
2850  iter = list.Find(w);
2851  if (iter)
2852  {
2853  iter = iter->GetPrevious();
2854  }
2855  }
2856 
2857  // Ran out of siblings, so make the current project active
2858  if (!iter && IsEnabled())
2859  {
2860  w = this;
2861  }
2862 
2863  // And make sure it's on top (only for floating windows...project window will not raise)
2864  // (Really only works on Windows)
2865  w->Raise();
2866 }
2867 
2868 //The following methods operate controls on specified tracks,
2869 //This will pop up the track panning dialog for specified track
2870 void AudacityProject::OnTrackPan()
2871 {
2872  Track *const track = mTrackPanel->GetFocusedTrack();
2873  if (!track || (track->GetKind() != Track::Wave)) {
2874  return;
2875  }
2876 
2877  LWSlider *slider = mTrackPanel->GetTrackInfo()->PanSlider
2878  (static_cast<WaveTrack*>(track));
2879  if (slider->ShowDialog()) {
2880  SetTrackPan(track, slider);
2881  }
2882 }
2883 
2884 void AudacityProject::OnTrackPanLeft()
2885 {
2886  Track *const track = mTrackPanel->GetFocusedTrack();
2887  if (!track || (track->GetKind() != Track::Wave)) {
2888  return;
2889  }
2890 
2891  LWSlider *slider = mTrackPanel->GetTrackInfo()->PanSlider
2892  (static_cast<WaveTrack*>(track));
2893  slider->Decrease(1);
2894  SetTrackPan(track, slider);
2895 }
2896 
2897 void AudacityProject::OnTrackPanRight()
2898 {
2899  Track *const track = mTrackPanel->GetFocusedTrack();
2900  if (!track || (track->GetKind() != Track::Wave)) {
2901  return;
2902  }
2903 
2904  LWSlider *slider = mTrackPanel->GetTrackInfo()->PanSlider
2905  (static_cast<WaveTrack*>(track));
2906  slider->Increase(1);
2907  SetTrackPan(track, slider);
2908 }
2909

2921  SetTrackGain(track, slider);
2922  }
2923 }

2956 void AudacityProject::OnTrackMute()
2957 {
2958  Track *t = NULL;
2959  if (!t) {
2960  t = mTrackPanel->GetFocusedTrack();
2961  if (!t || (t->GetKind() != Track::Wave))
2962  return;
2963  }
2964  DoTrackMute(t, false);
2965 }
2966

2968 {

2970  if (!t)
2971  {
2972  t = mTrackPanel->GetFocusedTrack();
2973  if (!t || (t->GetKind() != Track::Wave))
2974  return;
2975  }
2976  DoTrackSolo(t, false);
2977 }
2978 
2979 void AudacityProject::OnTrackClose()
2980 {
2981  Track *t = mTrackPanel->GetFocusedTrack();
2982  if (!t)
2983  return;
2984 
2985  if (IsAudioActive())
2986  {
2987  this->TP_DisplayStatusMessage(_("Can't delete track with active audio"));
2988  wxBell();
2989  return;
2990  }
2991 
2992  RemoveTrack(t);
2993 
2994  GetTrackPanel()->UpdateViewIfNoTracks();
2995  GetTrackPanel()->Refresh(false);
2996 }
2997 
2998 void AudacityProject::OnTrackMoveUp()
2999 {
3000  Track *const focusedTrack = mTrackPanel->GetFocusedTrack();
3001  if (mTracks->CanMoveUp(focusedTrack)) {
3002  MoveTrack(focusedTrack, OnMoveUpID);
3003  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
3004  }
3005 }
3006 
3007 void AudacityProject::OnTrackMoveDown()
3008 {
3009  Track *const focusedTrack = mTrackPanel->GetFocusedTrack();
3010  if (mTracks->CanMoveDown(focusedTrack)) {
3011  MoveTrack(focusedTrack, OnMoveDownID);
3012  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
3013  }
3014 }
3015 
3016 void AudacityProject::OnTrackMoveTop()
3017 {
3018  Track *const focusedTrack = mTrackPanel->GetFocusedTrack();
3019  if (mTracks->CanMoveUp(focusedTrack)) {
3020  MoveTrack(focusedTrack, OnMoveTopID);
3021  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
3022  }
3023 }
3024 
3025 void AudacityProject::OnTrackMoveBottom()
3026 {
3027  Track *const focusedTrack = mTrackPanel->GetFocusedTrack();
3028  if (mTracks->CanMoveDown(focusedTrack)) {
3029  MoveTrack(focusedTrack, OnMoveBottomID);
3030  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
3031  }
3032 }
3033 
3035 
3036 void AudacityProject::MoveTrack(Track* target, MoveChoice choice)
3037 {
3038  wxString direction;
3039 
3040  switch (choice)
3041  {
3042  case OnMoveTopID:
3043  /* i18n-hint: where the track is moving to.*/
3044  direction = _("to Top");
3045 
3046  while (mTracks->CanMoveUp(target)) {
3047  if (mTracks->Move(target, true)) {
3048  MixerBoard* pMixerBoard = this->GetMixerBoard(); // Update mixer board.
3049  if (pMixerBoard && (target->GetKind() == Track::Wave))
3050  pMixerBoard->MoveTrackCluster((WaveTrack*)target, true);
3051  }
3052  }
3053  break;
3054  case OnMoveBottomID:
3055  /* i18n-hint: where the track is moving to.*/
3056  direction = _("to Bottom");
3057 
3058  while (mTracks->CanMoveDown(target)) {
3059  if (mTracks->Move(target, false)) {
3060  MixerBoard* pMixerBoard = this->GetMixerBoard(); // Update mixer board.
3061  if (pMixerBoard && (target->GetKind() == Track::Wave))
3062  pMixerBoard->MoveTrackCluster((WaveTrack*)target, false);
3063  }
3064  }
3065  break;
3066  default:
3067  bool bUp = (OnMoveUpID == choice);
3068  /* i18n-hint: a direction.*/
3069  direction = bUp ? _("Up") : _("Down");
3070 
3071  if (mTracks->Move(target, bUp)) {
3072  MixerBoard* pMixerBoard = this->GetMixerBoard();
3073  if (pMixerBoard && (target->GetKind() == Track::Wave)) {
3074  pMixerBoard->MoveTrackCluster((WaveTrack*)target, bUp);
3075  }
3076  }
3077  }
3078 
3079  /* i18n-hint: Past tense of 'to move', as in 'moved audio track up'.*/
3080  wxString longDesc = (_("Moved"));
3081  /* i18n-hint: The direction of movement will be up, down, to top or to bottom.. */
3082  wxString shortDesc = (_("Move Track"));
3083 
3084  longDesc = (wxString::Format(wxT("%s '%s' %s"), longDesc.c_str(),
3085  target->GetName().c_str(), direction.c_str()));
3086  shortDesc = (wxString::Format(wxT("%s %s"), shortDesc.c_str(), direction.c_str()));
3087 
3088  PushState(longDesc, shortDesc);
3089  GetTrackPanel()->Refresh(false);
3090 }
3091 
3092 void AudacityProject::OnInputDevice()
3093 {
3094  DeviceToolBar *tb = GetDeviceToolBar();
3095  if (tb) {
3096  tb->ShowInputDialog();
3097  }
3098 }
3099

3219 
3220 double AudacityProject::NearestZeroCrossing(double t0)
3221 {
3222  // Window is 1/100th of a second.
3223  int windowSize = (int)(GetRate() / 100);
3224  float *dist = new float[windowSize];
3225  int i, j;
3226 
3227  for(i=0; i<windowSize; i++)
3228  dist[i] = 0.0;
3229 
3230  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
3231  Track *track = iter.First();
3232  while (track) {
3233  if (!track->GetSelected() || track->GetKind() != (Track::Wave)) {
3234  track = iter.Next();
3235  continue;
3236  }
3237  WaveTrack *one = (WaveTrack *)track;
3238  int oneWindowSize = (int)(one->GetRate() / 100);
3239  float *oneDist = new float[oneWindowSize];
3240  sampleCount s = one->TimeToLongSamples(t0);
3241  // fillTwo to ensure that missing values are treated as 2, and hence do not
3242  // get used as zero crossings.
3243  one->Get((samplePtr)oneDist, floatSample,
3244  s - oneWindowSize/2, oneWindowSize, fillTwo);
3245 
3246  // Start by penalizing downward motion. We prefer upward
3247  // zero crossings.
3248  if (oneDist[1] - oneDist[0] < 0)
3249  oneDist[0] = oneDist[0]*6 + (oneDist[0] > 0 ? 0.3 : -0.3);
3250  for(i=1; i<oneWindowSize; i++)
3251  if (oneDist[i] - oneDist[i-1] < 0)
3252  oneDist[i] = oneDist[i]*6 + (oneDist[i] > 0 ? 0.3 : -0.3);
3253 
3254  // Taking the absolute value -- apply a tiny LPF so square waves work.
3255  float newVal, oldVal = oneDist[0];
3256  oneDist[0] = fabs(.75 * oneDist[0] + .25 * oneDist[1]);
3257  for(i=1; i<oneWindowSize-1; i++)
3258  {
3259  newVal = fabs(.25 * oldVal + .5 * oneDist[i] + .25 * oneDist[i+1]);
3260  oldVal = oneDist[i];
3261  oneDist[i] = newVal;
3262  }
3263  oneDist[oneWindowSize-1] = fabs(.25 * oldVal +
3264  .75 * oneDist[oneWindowSize-1]);
3265 
3266  // TODO: The mixed rate zero crossing code is broken,
3267  // if oneWindowSize > windowSize we'll miss out some
3268  // samples - so they will still be zero, so we'll use them.
3269  for(i=0; i<windowSize; i++) {
3270  if (windowSize != oneWindowSize)
3271  j = i * (oneWindowSize-1) / (windowSize-1);
3272  else
3273  j = i;
3274 
3275  dist[i] += oneDist[j];
3276  // Apply a small penalty for distance from the original endpoint
3277  dist[i] += 0.1 * (abs(i - windowSize/2)) / float(windowSize/2);
3278  }
3279 
3280  delete [] oneDist;
3281  track = iter.Next();
3282  }
3283 
3284  // Find minimum
3285  int argmin = 0;
3286  float min = 3.0;
3287  for(i=0; i<windowSize; i++) {
3288  if (dist[i] < min) {
3289  argmin = i;
3290  min = dist[i];
3291  }
3292  }
3293 
3294  delete [] dist;
3295 
3296  return t0 + (argmin - windowSize/2)/GetRate();
3297 }
3298 
3299 void AudacityProject::OnZeroCrossing()
3300 {
3301  const double t0 = NearestZeroCrossing(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0());
3302  if (mViewInfo.selectedRegion.isPoint())
3303  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setTimes(t0, t0);
3304  else {
3305  const double t1 = NearestZeroCrossing(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
3306  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setTimes(t0, t1);
3307  }
3308 
3309  ModifyState(false);
3310 
3311  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
3312 }
3313 
3314 //
3315 // Effect Menus
3316 //
3317 
3322 bool AudacityProject::OnEffect(const PluginID & ID, int flags)
3323 {
3324  const PluginDescriptor *plug = PluginManager::Get().GetPlugin(ID);
3325  if (!plug)
3326  return false;
3327 
3328  EffectType type = plug->GetEffectType();
3329 
3330  // Make sure there's no activity since the effect is about to be applied
3331  // to the project's tracks. Mainly for Apply during RTP, but also used
3332  // for batch commands
3333  if (flags & OnEffectFlags::kConfigured)
3334  {
3335  OnStop();
3336  SelectAllIfNone();
3337  }
3338 
3339  wxGetApp().SetMissingAliasedFileWarningShouldShow(true);
3340 
3341  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
3342  Track *t = iter.First();
3343  WaveTrack *newTrack = NULL;
3344  wxWindow *focus = wxWindow::FindFocus();
3345 
3346  //double prevEndTime = mTracks->GetEndTime();
3347  int count = 0;
3348  bool clean = true;
3349  while (t) {
3350  if (t->GetSelected() && t->GetKind() == (Track::Wave)) {
3351  if (t->GetEndTime() != 0.0) clean = false;
3352  count++;
3353  }
3354  t = iter.Next();
3355  }
3356 
3357  if (count == 0) {
3358  // No tracks were selected...
3359  if (type == EffectTypeGenerate) {
3360  // Create a NEW track for the generated audio...
3361  newTrack = mTrackFactory->NewWaveTrack();
3362  mTracks->Add(newTrack);
3363  newTrack->SetSelected(true);
3364  }
3365  }
3366 
3367  EffectManager & em = EffectManager::Get();
3368 
3369  bool success = em.DoEffect(ID, this, mRate,
3370  mTracks, mTrackFactory,
3371  &mViewInfo.selectedRegion,
3372  (flags & OnEffectFlags::kConfigured) == 0);
3373 
3374  if (!success) {
3375  if (newTrack) {
3376  mTracks->Remove(newTrack);
3377  delete newTrack;
3378  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
3379  }
3380 
3381  // For now, we're limiting realtime preview to a single effect, so
3382  // make sure the menus reflect that fact that one may have just been
3383  // opened.
3384  UpdateMenus(false);
3385 
3386  return false;
3387  }
3388 
3389  if (em.GetSkipStateFlag())
3390  flags = flags | OnEffectFlags::kSkipState;
3391 
3392  if (!(flags & OnEffectFlags::kSkipState))
3393  {
3394  wxString shortDesc = em.GetEffectName(ID);
3395  wxString longDesc = em.GetEffectDescription(ID);
3396  PushState(longDesc, shortDesc);
3397  }
3398 
3399  if (!(flags & OnEffectFlags::kDontRepeatLast))
3400  {
3401  // Only remember a successful effect, don't rmemeber insert,
3402  // or analyze effects.
3403  if (type == EffectTypeProcess) {
3404  wxString shortDesc = em.GetEffectName(ID);
3405  mLastEffect = ID;
3406  wxString lastEffectDesc;
3407  /* i18n-hint: %s will be the name of the effect which will be
3408  * repeated if this menu item is chosen */
3409  lastEffectDesc.Printf(_("Repeat %s"), shortDesc.c_str());
3410  mCommandManager.Modify(wxT("RepeatLastEffect"), lastEffectDesc);
3411  }
3412  }
3413 
3414  //STM:
3415  //The following automatically re-zooms after sound was generated.
3416  // IMO, it was disorienting, removing to try out without re-fitting
3417  //mchinen:12/14/08 reapplying for generate effects
3418  if (type == EffectTypeGenerate)
3419  {
3420  if (count == 0 || (clean && mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0() == 0.0))
3421  OnZoomFit();
3422  // mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
3423  }
3424  RedrawProject();
3425  if (focus != NULL) {
3426  focus->SetFocus();
3427  }
3428  mTrackPanel->EnsureVisible(mTrackPanel->GetFirstSelectedTrack());
3429 
3430  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
3431 
3432  return true;
3433 }
3434 
3435 void AudacityProject::OnRepeatLastEffect(int WXUNUSED(index))
3436 {
3437  if (!mLastEffect.IsEmpty())
3438  {
3439  OnEffect(mLastEffect, OnEffectFlags::kConfigured);
3440  }
3441 }
3442

3446 void AudacityProject::OnManagePluginsMenu(EffectType type)
3447 {
3448  if (PluginManager::Get().ShowManager(this, type))
3449  {
3450  for (size_t i = 0; i < gAudacityProjects.GetCount(); i++) {
3451  AudacityProject *p = gAudacityProjects[i];
3452 
3453  p->RebuildMenuBar();
3454 #if defined(__WXGTK__)
3455  // Workaround for:
3456  //
3457  // http://bugzilla.audacityteam.org/show_bug.cgi?id=458
3458  //
3459  // This workaround should be removed when Audacity updates to wxWidgets 3.x which has a fix.
3460  wxRect r = p->GetRect();
3461  p->SetSize(wxSize(1,1));
3462  p->SetSize(r.GetSize());
3463 #endif
3464  }
3465  }
3466 }

3537 
3538 void AudacityProject::OnExportLabels()
3539 {
3540  Track *t;
3541  int numLabelTracks = 0;
3542 
3543  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
3544 
3545  wxString fName = _("labels.txt");
3546  t = iter.First();
3547  while (t) {
3548  if (t->GetKind() == Track::Label)
3549  {
3550  numLabelTracks++;
3551  fName = t->GetName();
3552  }
3553  t = iter.Next();
3554  }
3555 
3556  if (numLabelTracks == 0) {
3557  wxMessageBox(_("There are no label tracks to export."));
3558  return;
3559  }
3560 
3561  fName = FileSelector(_("Export Labels As:"),
3562  wxEmptyString,
3563  fName,
3564  wxT("txt"),
3565  wxT("*.txt"),
3566  wxFD_SAVE | wxFD_OVERWRITE_PROMPT | wxRESIZE_BORDER,
3567  this);
3568 
3569  if (fName == wxT(""))
3570  return;
3571 
3572  // Move existing files out of the way. Otherwise wxTextFile will
3573  // append to (rather than replace) the current file.
3574 
3575  if (wxFileExists(fName)) {
3576 #ifdef __WXGTK__
3577  wxString safetyFileName = fName + wxT("~");
3578 #else
3579  wxString safetyFileName = fName + wxT(".bak");
3580 #endif
3581 
3582  if (wxFileExists(safetyFileName))
3583  wxRemoveFile(safetyFileName);
3584 
3585  wxRename(fName, safetyFileName);
3586  }
3587 
3588  wxTextFile f(fName);
3589  f.Create();
3590  f.Open();
3591  if (!f.IsOpened()) {
3592  wxMessageBox(_("Couldn't write to file: ") + fName);
3593  return;
3594  }
3595 
3596  t = iter.First();
3597  while (t) {
3598  if (t->GetKind() == Track::Label)
3599  ((LabelTrack *) t)->Export(f);
3600 
3601  t = iter.Next();
3602  }
3603 
3604  f.Write();
3605  f.Close();
3606 }
3607 
3608 
3609 #ifdef USE_MIDI
3610 void AudacityProject::OnExportMIDI(){
3611  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
3612  Track *t = iter.First();
3613  int numNoteTracksSelected = 0;
3614  NoteTrack *nt = NULL;
3615 
3616  // Iterate through once to make sure that there is
3617  // exactly one NoteTrack selected.
3618  while (t) {
3619  if (t->GetSelected()) {
3620  if(t->GetKind() == Track::Note) {
3621  numNoteTracksSelected++;
3622  nt = (NoteTrack *) t;
3623  }
3624  }
3625  t = iter.Next();
3626  }
3627 
3628  if(numNoteTracksSelected > 1){
3629  wxMessageBox(wxString::Format(wxT(
3630  "Please select only one MIDI track at a time.")));
3631  return;
3632  }
3633 
3634  wxASSERT(nt);
3635  if (!nt)
3636  return;
3637 
3638  while(true){
3639 
3640  wxString fName = wxT("");
3641 
3642  fName = FileSelector(_("Export MIDI As:"),
3643  wxEmptyString,
3644  fName,
3645  wxT(".mid|.gro"),
3646  _("MIDI file (*.mid)|*.mid|Allegro file (*.gro)|*.gro"),
3647  wxFD_SAVE | wxFD_OVERWRITE_PROMPT | wxRESIZE_BORDER,
3648  this);
3649 
3650  if (fName == wxT(""))
3651  return;
3652 
3653  if(!fName.Contains(wxT("."))) {
3654  fName = fName + wxT(".mid");
3655  }
3656 
3657  // Move existing files out of the way. Otherwise wxTextFile will
3658  // append to (rather than replace) the current file.
3659 
3660  if (wxFileExists(fName)) {
3661 #ifdef __WXGTK__
3662  wxString safetyFileName = fName + wxT("~");
3663 #else
3664  wxString safetyFileName = fName + wxT(".bak");
3665 #endif
3666 
3667  if (wxFileExists(safetyFileName))
3668  wxRemoveFile(safetyFileName);
3669 
3670  wxRename(fName, safetyFileName);
3671  }
3672 
3673  if(fName.EndsWith(wxT(".mid")) || fName.EndsWith(wxT(".midi"))) {
3674  nt->ExportMIDI(fName);
3675  } else if(fName.EndsWith(wxT(".gro"))) {
3676  nt->ExportAllegro(fName);
3677  } else {
3678  wxString msg = _("You have selected a filename with an unrecognized file extension.\nDo you want to continue?");
3679  wxString title = _("Export MIDI");
3680  int id = wxMessageBox(msg, title, wxYES_NO);
3681  if (id == wxNO) {
3682  continue;
3683  } else if (id == wxYES) {
3684  nt->ExportMIDI(fName);
3685  }
3686  }
3687  break;
3688  }
3689 }
3690 #endif // USE_MIDI
3691 
3692 
3693 void AudacityProject::OnExport()
3694 {
3695  Exporter e;
3696 
3697  wxGetApp().SetMissingAliasedFileWarningShouldShow(true);
3698  e.Process(this, false, 0.0, mTracks->GetEndTime());
3699 }

3701 void AudacityProject::OnExportSelection()

3705  wxGetApp().SetMissingAliasedFileWarningShouldShow(true);
3706  e.SetFileDialogTitle( _("Export Selected Audio") );
3707  e.Process(this, true, mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
3708  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
3709 }

3718 
3719 void AudacityProject::OnPreferences()
3720 {
3721  GlobalPrefsDialog dialog(this /* parent */ );
3722 
3723  if (!dialog.ShowModal()) {
3724  // Canceled
3725  return;
3726  }
3727 
3728  // LL: Moved from PrefsDialog since wxWidgets on OSX can't deal with
3729  // rebuilding the menus while the PrefsDialog is still in the modal
3730  // state.
3731  for (size_t i = 0; i < gAudacityProjects.GetCount(); i++) {
3732  AudacityProject *p = gAudacityProjects[i];
3733 
3734  p->RebuildMenuBar();
3735  p->RebuildOtherMenus();
3736 #if defined(__WXGTK__)
3737  // Workaround for:
3738  //
3739  // http://bugzilla.audacityteam.org/show_bug.cgi?id=458
3740  //
3741  // This workaround should be removed when Audacity updates to wxWidgets 3.x which has a fix.
3742  wxRect r = p->GetRect();
3743  p->SetSize(wxSize(1,1));
3744  p->SetSize(r.GetSize());
3745 #endif
3746  }
3747 }

3759 //
3760 // Edit Menu
3761 //
3762 
3763 void AudacityProject::OnUndo()
3764 {
3765  if (!GetUndoManager()->UndoAvailable()) {
3766  wxMessageBox(_("Nothing to undo"));
3767  return;
3768  }
3769 
3770  // can't undo while dragging
3771  if (mTrackPanel->IsMouseCaptured()) {
3772  return;
3773  }
3774 
3775  const UndoState &state = GetUndoManager()->Undo(&mViewInfo.selectedRegion);
3776  PopState(state);
3777 
3778  mTrackPanel->SetFocusedTrack(NULL);
3779  mTrackPanel->EnsureVisible(mTrackPanel->GetFirstSelectedTrack());
3780 
3781  RedrawProject();
3782 
3783  if (mHistoryWindow)
3784  mHistoryWindow->UpdateDisplay();
3785 
3786  ModifyUndoMenuItems();
3787 }
3788 
3789 void AudacityProject::OnRedo()
3790 {
3791  if (!GetUndoManager()->RedoAvailable()) {
3792  wxMessageBox(_("Nothing to redo"));
3793  return;
3794  }
3795  // Can't redo whilst dragging
3796  if (mTrackPanel->IsMouseCaptured()) {
3797  return;
3798  }
3799 
3800  const UndoState &state = GetUndoManager()->Redo(&mViewInfo.selectedRegion);
3801  PopState(state);
3802 
3803  mTrackPanel->SetFocusedTrack(NULL);
3804  mTrackPanel->EnsureVisible(mTrackPanel->GetFirstSelectedTrack());
3805 
3806  RedrawProject();
3807 
3808  if (mHistoryWindow)
3809  mHistoryWindow->UpdateDisplay();
3810 
3811  ModifyUndoMenuItems();
3812 }
3813 
3814 void AudacityProject::OnCut()
3815 {
3816  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
3817  Track *n = iter.First();
3818  Track *dest;
3819 
3820  // This doesn't handle cutting labels, it handles
3821  // cutting the _text_ inside of labels, i.e. if you're
3822  // in the middle of editing the label text and select "Cut".
3823 
3824  while (n) {
3825  if (n->GetSelected()) {
3826  if (n->GetKind() == Track::Label) {
3827  if (((LabelTrack *)n)->CutSelectedText()) {
3828  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
3829  return;
3830  }
3831  }
3832  }
3833  n = iter.Next();
3834  }
3835 
3836  ClearClipboard();
3837  n = iter.First();
3838  while (n) {
3839  if (n->GetSelected()) {
3840  dest = NULL;
3841 #if defined(USE_MIDI)
3842  if (n->GetKind() == Track::Note)
3843  // Since portsmf has a built-in cut operator, we use that instead
3844  n->Cut(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
3845  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1(), &dest);
3846  else
3847 #endif
3848  n->Copy(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
3849  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1(), &dest);
3850 
3851  if (dest) {
3852  dest->SetChannel(n->GetChannel());
3853  dest->SetLinked(n->GetLinked());
3854  dest->SetName(n->GetName());
3855  msClipboard->Add(dest);
3856  }
3857  }
3858  n = iter.Next();
3859  }
3860 
3861  n = iter.First();
3862  while (n) {
3863  // We clear from selected and sync-lock selected tracks.
3864  if (n->GetSelected() || n->IsSyncLockSelected()) {
3865  switch (n->GetKind())
3866  {
3867 #if defined(USE_MIDI)
3868  case Track::Note:
3869  //if NoteTrack, it was cut, so do not clear anything
3870  break;
3871 #endif
3872  case Track::Wave:
3873  if (gPrefs->Read(wxT("/GUI/EnableCutLines"), (long)0)) {
3874  ((WaveTrack*)n)->ClearAndAddCutLine(
3875  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
3876  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
3877  break;
3878  }
3879 
3880  // Fall through
3881 
3882  default:
3883  n->Clear(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
3884  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
3885  break;
3886  }
3887  }
3888  n = iter.Next();
3889  }
3890 
3891  msClipT0 = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0();
3892  msClipT1 = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1();
3893  msClipProject = this;
3894 
3895  PushState(_("Cut to the clipboard"), _("Cut"));
3896 
3897  RedrawProject();
3898 
3899  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.collapseToT0();
3900 }
3901 
3902 
3903 void AudacityProject::OnSplitCut()
3904 {
3905  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
3906  Track *n = iter.First();
3907  Track *dest;
3908 
3909  ClearClipboard();
3910  while (n) {
3911  if (n->GetSelected()) {
3912  dest = NULL;
3913  if (n->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
3914  {
3915  ((WaveTrack*)n)->SplitCut(
3916  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
3917  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1(), &dest);
3918  } else
3919  {
3920  n->Copy(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
3921  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1(), &dest);
3922  n->Silence(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
3923  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
3924  }
3925  if (dest) {
3926  dest->SetChannel(n->GetChannel());
3927  dest->SetLinked(n->GetLinked());
3928  dest->SetName(n->GetName());
3929  msClipboard->Add(dest);
3930  }
3931  }
3932  n = iter.Next();
3933  }
3934 
3935  msClipT0 = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0();
3936  msClipT1 = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1();
3937  msClipProject = this;
3938 
3939  PushState(_("Split-cut to the clipboard"), _("Split Cut"));
3940 
3941  RedrawProject();
3942 }
3943 
3944 
3945 void AudacityProject::OnCopy()
3946 {
3947 
3948  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
3949 
3950  Track *n = iter.First();
3951  Track *dest;
3952 
3953  while (n) {
3954  if (n->GetSelected()) {
3955  if (n->GetKind() == Track::Label) {
3956  if (((LabelTrack *)n)->CopySelectedText()) {
3957  //mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
3958  return;
3959  }
3960  }
3961  }
3962  n = iter.Next();
3963  }
3964 
3965  ClearClipboard();
3966  n = iter.First();
3967  while (n) {
3968  if (n->GetSelected()) {
3969  dest = NULL;
3970  n->Copy(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
3971  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1(), &dest);
3972  if (dest) {
3973  dest->SetChannel(n->GetChannel());
3974  dest->SetLinked(n->GetLinked());
3975  dest->SetName(n->GetName());
3976  msClipboard->Add(dest);
3977  }
3978  }
3979  n = iter.Next();
3980  }
3981 
3982  msClipT0 = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0();
3983  msClipT1 = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1();
3984  msClipProject = this;
3985 
3986  //Make sure the menus/toolbar states get updated
3987  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
3988 }
3989 
3990 void AudacityProject::OnPaste()
3991 {
3992  // Handle text paste (into active label) first.
3993  if (this->HandlePasteText())
3994  return;
3995 
3996  // If nothing's selected, we just insert NEW tracks.
3997  if (this->HandlePasteNothingSelected())
3998  return;
3999 
4000  // Otherwise, paste into the selected tracks.
4001  double t0 = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0();
4002  double t1 = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1();
4003 
4004  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
4005  TrackListIterator clipIter(msClipboard);
4006 
4007  Track *n = iter.First();
4008  Track *c = clipIter.First();
4009  if (c == NULL)
4010  return;
4011  Track *ff = NULL;
4012  Track *tmpSrc = NULL;
4013  Track *tmpC = NULL;
4014  Track *prev = NULL;
4015 
4016  bool bAdvanceClipboard = true;
4017  bool bPastedSomething = false;
4018  bool bTrackTypeMismatch = false;
4019 
4020  while (n && c) {
4021  if (n->GetSelected()) {
4022  bAdvanceClipboard = true;
4023  if (tmpC)
4024  c = tmpC;
4025  if (c->GetKind() != n->GetKind()) {
4026  if (!bTrackTypeMismatch) {
4027  tmpSrc = prev;
4028  tmpC = c;
4029  }
4030  bTrackTypeMismatch = true;
4031  bAdvanceClipboard = false;
4032  c = tmpSrc;
4033 
4034  // If the types still don't match...
4035  while (c && c->GetKind() != n->GetKind()) {
4036  prev = c;
4037  c = clipIter.Next();
4038  }
4039  }
4040 
4041  // Handle case where the first track in clipboard
4042  // is of different type than the first selected track
4043  if (!c) {
4044  c = tmpC;
4045  while (n && (c->GetKind() != n->GetKind() || !n->GetSelected()))
4046  {
4047  // Must perform sync-lock adjustment before incrementing n
4048  if (n->IsSyncLockSelected()) {
4049  bPastedSomething |= n->SyncLockAdjust(t1, t0+(msClipT1 - msClipT0));
4050  }
4051  n = iter.Next();
4052  }
4053  if (!n)
4054  c = NULL;
4055  }
4056 
4057  // The last possible case for cross-type pastes: triggered when we try to
4058  // paste 1+ tracks from one type into 1+ tracks of another type. If
4059  // there's a mix of types, this shouldn't run.
4060  if (!c) {
4061  wxMessageBox(
4062  _("Pasting one type of track into another is not allowed."),
4063  _("Error"), wxICON_ERROR, this);
4064  c = n;//so we don't trigger any !c conditions on our way out
4065  break;
4066  }
4067 
4068  // When trying to copy from stereo to mono track, show error and exit
4069  // TODO: Automatically offer user to mix down to mono (unfortunately
4070  // this is not easy to implement
4071  if (c->GetLinked() && !n->GetLinked())
4072  {
4073  wxMessageBox(
4074  _("Copying stereo audio into a mono track is not allowed."),
4075  _("Error"), wxICON_ERROR, this);
4076  break;
4077  }
4078 
4079  if (!ff)
4080  ff = n;
4081 
4082  if (msClipProject != this && c->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
4083  ((WaveTrack *) c)->Lock();
4084 
4085  if (c->GetKind() == Track::Wave && n && n->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
4086  {
4087  bPastedSomething |=
4088  ((WaveTrack*)n)->ClearAndPaste(t0, t1, (WaveTrack*)c, true, true);
4089  }
4090  else if (c->GetKind() == Track::Label &&
4091  n && n->GetKind() == Track::Label)
4092  {
4093  ((LabelTrack *)n)->Clear(t0, t1);
4094 
4095  // To be (sort of) consistent with Clear behavior, we'll only shift
4096  // them if sync-lock is on.
4097  if (IsSyncLocked())
4098  ((LabelTrack *)n)->ShiftLabelsOnInsert(msClipT1 - msClipT0, t0);
4099 
4100  bPastedSomething |= ((LabelTrack *)n)->PasteOver(t0, c);
4101  }
4102  else
4103  {
4104  bPastedSomething |= n->Paste(t0, c);
4105  }
4106 
4107  // When copying from mono to stereo track, paste the wave form
4108  // to both channels
4109  if (n->GetLinked() && !c->GetLinked())
4110  {
4111  n = iter.Next();
4112 
4113  if (n->GetKind() == Track::Wave) {
4114  bPastedSomething |= ((WaveTrack *)n)->ClearAndPaste(t0, t1, c, true, true);
4115  }
4116  else
4117  {
4118  n->Clear(t0, t1);
4119  bPastedSomething |= n->Paste(t0, c);
4120  }
4121  }
4122 
4123  if (msClipProject != this && c->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
4124  ((WaveTrack *) c)->Unlock();
4125 
4126  if (bAdvanceClipboard){
4127  prev = c;
4128  c = clipIter.Next();
4129  }
4130  } // if (n->GetSelected())
4131  else if (n->IsSyncLockSelected())
4132  {
4133  bPastedSomething |= n->SyncLockAdjust(t1, t0 + msClipT1 - msClipT0);
4134  }
4135 
4136  n = iter.Next();
4137  }
4138 
4139  // This block handles the cases where our clipboard is smaller
4140  // than the amount of selected destination tracks. We take the
4141  // last wave track, and paste that one into the remaining
4142  // selected tracks.
4143  if ( n && !c )
4144  {
4145  TrackListOfKindIterator clipWaveIter(Track::Wave, msClipboard);
4146  c = clipWaveIter.Last();
4147 
4148  while (n) {
4149  if (n->GetSelected() && n->GetKind()==Track::Wave) {
4150  if (c && c->GetKind() == Track::Wave) {
4151  bPastedSomething |=
4152  ((WaveTrack *)n)->ClearAndPaste(t0, t1, (WaveTrack *)c, true, true);
4153  }
4154  else {
4155  WaveTrack *tmp;
4156  tmp = mTrackFactory->NewWaveTrack( ((WaveTrack*)n)->GetSampleFormat(), ((WaveTrack*)n)->GetRate());
4157  bool bResult = tmp->InsertSilence(0.0, msClipT1 - msClipT0); // MJS: Is this correct?
4158  wxASSERT(bResult); // TO DO: Actually handle this.
4159  wxUnusedVar(bResult);
4160  tmp->Flush();
4161 
4162  bPastedSomething |=
4163  ((WaveTrack *)n)->ClearAndPaste(t0, t1, tmp, true, true);
4164 
4165  delete tmp;
4166  }
4167  }
4168  else if (n->GetKind() == Track::Label && n->GetSelected())
4169  {
4170  ((LabelTrack *)n)->Clear(t0, t1);
4171 
4172  // As above, only shift labels if sync-lock is on.
4173  if (IsSyncLocked())
4174  ((LabelTrack *)n)->ShiftLabelsOnInsert(msClipT1 - msClipT0, t0);
4175  }
4176  else if (n->IsSyncLockSelected())
4177  {
4178  n->SyncLockAdjust(t1, t0 + msClipT1 - msClipT0);
4179  }
4180 
4181  n = iter.Next();
4182  }
4183  }
4184 
4185  // TODO: What if we clicked past the end of the track?
4186 
4187  if (bPastedSomething)
4188  {
4189  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT1(t0 + msClipT1 - msClipT0);
4190 
4191  PushState(_("Pasted from the clipboard"), _("Paste"));
4192 
4193  RedrawProject();
4194 
4195  if (ff)
4196  mTrackPanel->EnsureVisible(ff);
4197  }
4198 }
4199 
4200 // Handle text paste (into active label), if any. Return true if did paste.
4201 // (This was formerly the first part of overly-long OnPaste.)
4202 bool AudacityProject::HandlePasteText()
4203 {
4204  TrackListOfKindIterator iterLabelTrack(Track::Label, mTracks);
4205  LabelTrack* pLabelTrack = (LabelTrack*)(iterLabelTrack.First());
4206  while (pLabelTrack)
4207  {
4208  // Does this track have an active label?
4209  if (pLabelTrack->IsSelected()) {
4210 
4211  // Yes, so try pasting into it
4212  if (pLabelTrack->PasteSelectedText(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
4213  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1()))
4214  {
4215  PushState(_("Pasted text from the clipboard"), _("Paste"));
4216 
4217  // Make sure caret is in view
4218  int x;
4219  if (pLabelTrack->CalcCursorX(this, &x)) {
4220  mTrackPanel->ScrollIntoView(x);
4221  }
4222 
4223  // Redraw everyting (is that necessary???) and bail
4224  RedrawProject();
4225  return true;
4226  }
4227  }
4228  pLabelTrack = (LabelTrack *) iterLabelTrack.Next();
4229  }
4230  return false;
4231 }
4232 
4233 // Return true if nothing selected, regardless of paste result.
4234 // If nothing was selected, create and paste into NEW tracks.
4235 // (This was formerly the second part of overly-long OnPaste.)
4236 bool AudacityProject::HandlePasteNothingSelected()
4237 {
4238  // First check whether anything's selected.
4239  bool bAnySelected = false;
4240  TrackListIterator iterTrack(mTracks);
4241  Track* pTrack = iterTrack.First();
4242  while (pTrack) {
4243  if (pTrack->GetSelected())
4244  {
4245  bAnySelected = true;
4246  break;
4247  }
4248  pTrack = iterTrack.Next();
4249  }
4250 
4251  if (bAnySelected)
4252  return false;
4253  else
4254  {
4255  TrackListIterator iterClip(msClipboard);
4256  Track* pClip = iterClip.First();
4257  if (!pClip)
4258  return true; // nothing to paste
4259 
4260  Track* pNewTrack;
4261  Track* pFirstNewTrack = NULL;
4262  while (pClip) {
4263  if ((msClipProject != this) && (pClip->GetKind() == Track::Wave))
4264  ((WaveTrack*)pClip)->Lock();
4265 
4266  switch (pClip->GetKind()) {
4267  case Track::Wave:
4268  {
4269  WaveTrack *w = (WaveTrack *)pClip;
4270  pNewTrack = mTrackFactory->NewWaveTrack(w->GetSampleFormat(), w->GetRate());
4271  }
4272  break;
4273  #ifdef USE_MIDI
4274  case Track::Note:
4275  pNewTrack = mTrackFactory->NewNoteTrack();
4276  break;
4277  #endif // USE_MIDI
4278  case Track::Label:
4279  pNewTrack = mTrackFactory->NewLabelTrack();
4280  break;
4281  case Track::Time:
4282  pNewTrack = mTrackFactory->NewTimeTrack();
4283  break;
4284  default:
4285  pClip = iterClip.Next();
4286  continue;
4287  }
4288  wxASSERT(pClip);
4289 
4290  pNewTrack->SetLinked(pClip->GetLinked());
4291  pNewTrack->SetChannel(pClip->GetChannel());
4292  pNewTrack->SetName(pClip->GetName());
4293 
4294  bool bResult = pNewTrack->Paste(0.0, pClip);
4295  wxASSERT(bResult); // TO DO: Actually handle this.
4296  wxUnusedVar(bResult);
4297  mTracks->Add(pNewTrack);
4298  pNewTrack->SetSelected(true);
4299 
4300  if (msClipProject != this && pClip->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
4301  ((WaveTrack *) pClip)->Unlock();
4302 
4303  if (!pFirstNewTrack)
4304  pFirstNewTrack = pNewTrack;
4305 
4306  pClip = iterClip.Next();
4307  }
4308 
4309  // Select some pasted samples, which is probably impossible to get right
4310  // with various project and track sample rates.
4311  // So do it at the sample rate of the project
4312  AudacityProject *p = GetActiveProject();
4313  double projRate = p->GetRate();
4314  double quantT0 = QUANTIZED_TIME(msClipT0, projRate);
4315  double quantT1 = QUANTIZED_TIME(msClipT1, projRate);
4316  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setTimes(
4317  0.0, // anywhere else and this should be
4318  // half a sample earlier
4319  quantT1 - quantT0);
4320 
4321  PushState(_("Pasted from the clipboard"), _("Paste"));
4322 
4323  RedrawProject();
4324 
4325  if (pFirstNewTrack)
4326  mTrackPanel->EnsureVisible(pFirstNewTrack);
4327 
4328  return true;
4329  }
4330 }
4331 
4332 
4333 // Creates a NEW label in each selected label track with text from the system
4334 // clipboard
4335 void AudacityProject::OnPasteNewLabel()
4336 {
4337  bool bPastedSomething = false;
4338 
4339  SelectedTrackListOfKindIterator iter(Track::Label, mTracks);
4340  Track *t = iter.First();
4341  if (!t)
4342  {
4343  // If there are no selected label tracks, try to choose the first label
4344  // track after some other selected track
4345  TrackListIterator iter1(mTracks);
4346  for (Track *t1 = iter1.First(); t1; t1 = iter1.Next()) {
4347  if (t1->GetSelected()) {
4348  // Look for a label track
4349  while (0 != (t1 = iter1.Next())) {
4350  if (t1->GetKind() == Track::Label) {
4351  t = t1;
4352  break;
4353  }
4354  }
4355  if (t) break;
4356  }
4357  }
4358 
4359  // If no match found, add one
4360  if (!t) {
4361  t = new LabelTrack(mDirManager);
4362  mTracks->Add(t);
4363  }
4364 
4365  // Select this track so the loop picks it up
4366  t->SetSelected(true);
4367  }
4368 
4369  LabelTrack *plt = NULL; // the previous track
4370  for (Track *t = iter.First(); t; t = iter.Next())
4371  {
4372  LabelTrack *lt = (LabelTrack *)t;
4373 
4374  // Unselect the last label, so we'll have just one active label when
4375  // we're done
4376  if (plt)
4377  plt->Unselect();
4378 
4379  // Add a NEW label, paste into it
4380  // Paul L: copy whatever defines the selected region, not just times
4381  lt->AddLabel(mViewInfo.selectedRegion);
4382  if (lt->PasteSelectedText(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
4383  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1()))
4384  bPastedSomething = true;
4385 
4386  // Set previous track
4387  plt = lt;
4388  }
4389 
4390  // plt should point to the last label track pasted to -- ensure it's visible
4391  // and set focus
4392  if (plt) {
4393  mTrackPanel->EnsureVisible(plt);
4394  mTrackPanel->SetFocus();
4395  }
4396 
4397  if (bPastedSomething) {
4398  PushState(_("Pasted from the clipboard"), _("Paste Text to New Label"));
4399 
4400  // Is this necessary? (carried over from former logic in OnPaste())
4401  RedrawProject();
4402  }
4403 }
4404 
4405 void AudacityProject::OnPasteOver() // not currently in use it appears
4406 {
4407  if((msClipT1 - msClipT0) > 0.0)
4408  {
4409  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT1(
4410  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0() + (msClipT1 - msClipT0));
4411  // MJS: pointless, given what we do in OnPaste?
4412  }
4413  OnPaste();
4414 
4415  return;
4416 }
4417 
4418 void AudacityProject::OnTrim()
4419 {
4420  if (mViewInfo.selectedRegion.isPoint())
4421  return;
4422 
4423  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
4424  Track *n = iter.First();
4425 
4426  while (n) {
4427  if (n->GetSelected()) {
4428  switch (n->GetKind())
4429  {
4430 #if defined(USE_MIDI)
4431  case Track::Note:
4432  ((NoteTrack*)n)->Trim(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
4433  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
4434  break;
4435 #endif
4436 
4437  case Track::Wave:
4438  //Delete the section before the left selector
4439  ((WaveTrack*)n)->Trim(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
4440  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
4441  break;
4442 
4443  default:
4444  break;
4445  }
4446  }
4447  n = iter.Next();
4448  }
4449 
4450  PushState(wxString::Format(_("Trim selected audio tracks from %.2f seconds to %.2f seconds"),
4451  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(), mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1()),
4452  _("Trim Audio"));
4453 
4454  RedrawProject();
4455 }
4456 
4457 void AudacityProject::OnDelete()
4458 {
4459  Clear();
4460 }
4461 
4462 void AudacityProject::OnSplitDelete()
4463 {
4464  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
4465 
4466  Track *n = iter.First();
4467 
4468  while (n) {
4469  if (n->GetSelected()) {
4470  if (n->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
4471  {
4472  ((WaveTrack*)n)->SplitDelete(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
4473  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
4474  }
4475  else {
4476  n->Silence(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
4477  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
4478  }
4479  }
4480  n = iter.Next();
4481  }
4482 
4483  PushState(wxString::Format(_("Split-deleted %.2f seconds at t=%.2f"),
4484  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.duration(),
4485  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0()),
4486  _("Split Delete"));
4487 
4488  RedrawProject();
4489 }
4490 
4491 void AudacityProject::OnDisjoin()
4492 {
4493  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
4494 
4495  Track *n = iter.First();
4496 
4497  while (n) {
4498  if (n->GetSelected()) {
4499  if (n->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
4500  {
4501  ((WaveTrack*)n)->Disjoin(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
4502  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
4503  }
4504  }
4505  n = iter.Next();
4506  }
4507 
4508  PushState(wxString::Format(_("Detached %.2f seconds at t=%.2f"),
4509  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.duration(),
4510  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0()),
4511  _("Detach"));
4512 
4513  RedrawProject();
4514 }
4515 
4516 void AudacityProject::OnJoin()
4517 {
4518  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
4519 
4520  Track *n = iter.First();
4521 
4522  while (n) {
4523  if (n->GetSelected()) {
4524  if (n->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
4525  {
4526  ((WaveTrack*)n)->Join(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
4527  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
4528  }
4529  }
4530  n = iter.Next();
4531  }
4532 
4533  PushState(wxString::Format(_("Joined %.2f seconds at t=%.2f"),
4534  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.duration(),
4535  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0()),
4536  _("Join"));
4537 
4538  RedrawProject();
4539 }
4540 
4541 void AudacityProject::OnSilence()
4542 {
4543  SelectedTrackListOfKindIterator iter(Track::Wave, mTracks);
4544 
4545  for (Track *n = iter.First(); n; n = iter.Next())
4546  n->Silence(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(), mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
4547 
4548  PushState(wxString::
4549  Format(_("Silenced selected tracks for %.2f seconds at %.2f"),
4550  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.duration(),
4551  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0()),
4552  _("Silence"));
4553 
4554  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
4555 }
4556 
4557 void AudacityProject::OnDuplicate()
4558 {
4559  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
4560 
4561  Track *l = iter.Last();
4562  Track *n = iter.First();
4563 
4564  while (n) {
4565  if (n->GetSelected()) {
4566  Track *dest = NULL;
4567  n->Copy(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
4568  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1(), &dest);
4569  if (dest) {
4570  dest->Init(*n);
4571  dest->SetOffset(wxMax(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(), n->GetOffset()));
4572  mTracks->Add(dest);
4573  }
4574  }
4575 
4576  if (n == l) {
4577  break;
4578  }
4579 
4580  n = iter.Next();
4581  }
4582 
4583  PushState(_("Duplicated"), _("Duplicate"));
4584 
4585  RedrawProject();
4586 }
4587 
4588 void AudacityProject::OnCutLabels()
4589 {
4590  if( mViewInfo.selectedRegion.isPoint() )
4591  return;
4592 
4593  // Because of grouping the copy may need to operate on different tracks than
4594  // the clear, so we do these actions separately.
4595  EditClipboardByLabel( &WaveTrack::CopyNonconst );
4596 
4597  if( gPrefs->Read( wxT( "/GUI/EnableCutLines" ), ( long )0 ) )
4598  EditByLabel( &WaveTrack::ClearAndAddCutLine, true );
4599  else
4600  EditByLabel( &WaveTrack::Clear, true );
4601 
4602  msClipProject = this;
4603 
4604  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.collapseToT0();
4605 
4606  PushState(
4607  /* i18n-hint: (verb) past tense. Audacity has just cut the labeled audio regions.*/
4608  _( "Cut labeled audio regions to clipboard" ),
4609  /* i18n-hint: (verb)*/
4610  _( "Cut Labeled Audio" ) );
4611 
4612  RedrawProject();
4613 }
4614 
4615 void AudacityProject::OnSplitCutLabels()
4616 {
4617  if( mViewInfo.selectedRegion.isPoint() )
4618  return;
4619 
4620  EditClipboardByLabel( &WaveTrack::SplitCut );
4621 
4622  msClipProject = this;
4623 
4624  PushState(
4625  /* i18n-hint: (verb) Audacity has just split cut the labeled audio regions*/
4626  _( "Split Cut labeled audio regions to clipboard" ),
4627  /* i18n-hint: (verb) Do a special kind of cut on the labels*/
4628  _( "Split Cut Labeled Audio" ) );
4629 
4630  RedrawProject();
4631 }
4632 
4633 void AudacityProject::OnCopyLabels()
4634 {
4635  if( mViewInfo.selectedRegion.isPoint() )
4636  return;
4637 
4638  EditClipboardByLabel( &WaveTrack::CopyNonconst );
4639 
4640  msClipProject = this;
4641 
4642  PushState( _( "Copied labeled audio regions to clipboard" ),
4643  /* i18n-hint: (verb)*/
4644  _( "Copy Labeled Audio" ) );
4645 
4646  mTrackPanel->Refresh( false );
4647 }
4648

4650 {

4652  return;

4655 
4656  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.collapseToT0();
4657 
4658  PushState(
4659  /* i18n-hint: (verb) Audacity has just deleted the labeled audio regions*/
4660  _( "Deleted labeled audio regions" ),
4661  /* i18n-hint: (verb)*/
4662  _( "Delete Labeled Audio" ) );
4663

4665 }

4745 
4746 void AudacityProject::OnSplit()
4747 {
4748  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
4749 
4750  double sel0 = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0();
4751  double sel1 = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1();
4752 
4753  for (Track* n=iter.First(); n; n = iter.Next())
4754  {
4755  if (n->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
4756  {
4757  WaveTrack* wt = (WaveTrack*)n;
4758  if (wt->GetSelected())
4759  wt->Split( sel0, sel1 );
4760  }
4761  }
4762 
4763  PushState(_("Split"), _("Split"));
4764  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
4765 #if 0
4766 //ANSWER-ME: Do we need to keep this commented out OnSplit() code?
4767 // This whole section no longer used...
4768  /*
4769  * Previous (pre-multiclip) implementation of "Split" command
4770  * This does work only when a range is selected!
4771  *
4772  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
4773 
4774  Track *n = iter.First();
4775  Track *dest;
4776 
4777  TrackList newTracks;
4778 
4779  while (n) {
4780  if (n->GetSelected()) {
4781  double sel0 = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0();
4782  double sel1 = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1();
4783 
4784  dest = NULL;
4785  n->Copy(sel0, sel1, &dest);
4786  if (dest) {
4787  dest->Init(*n);
4788  dest->SetOffset(wxMax(sel0, n->GetOffset()));
4789 
4790  if (sel1 >= n->GetEndTime())
4791  n->Clear(sel0, sel1);
4792  else if (sel0 <= n->GetOffset()) {
4793  n->Clear(sel0, sel1);
4794  n->SetOffset(sel1);
4795  } else
4796  n->Silence(sel0, sel1);
4797 
4798  newTracks.Add(dest);
4799  }
4800  }
4801  n = iter.Next();
4802  }
4803 
4804  TrackListIterator nIter(&newTracks);
4805  n = nIter.First();
4806  while (n) {
4807  mTracks->Add(n);
4808  n = nIter.Next();
4809  }
4810 
4811  PushState(_("Split"), _("Split"));
4812 
4813  FixScrollbars();
4814  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
4815  */
4816 #endif
4817 }
4818 
4819 void AudacityProject::OnSplitNew()
4820 {
4821  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
4822  Track *l = iter.Last();
4823 
4824  for (Track *n = iter.First(); n; n = iter.Next()) {
4825  if (n->GetSelected()) {
4826  Track *dest = NULL;
4827  double newt0 = 0, newt1 = 0;
4828  double offset = n->GetOffset();
4829  if (n->GetKind() == Track::Wave) {
4830  // Clips must be aligned to sample positions or the NEW clip will not fit in the gap where it came from
4831  offset = ((WaveTrack*)n)->LongSamplesToTime(((WaveTrack*)n)->TimeToLongSamples(offset));
4832  newt0 = ((WaveTrack*)n)->LongSamplesToTime(((WaveTrack*)n)->TimeToLongSamples(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0()));
4833  newt1 = ((WaveTrack*)n)->LongSamplesToTime(((WaveTrack*)n)->TimeToLongSamples(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1()));
4834  ((WaveTrack*)n)->SplitCut(newt0, newt1, &dest);
4835  }
4836 #if 0
4837  // LL: For now, just skip all non-wave tracks since the other do not
4838  // yet support proper splitting.
4839  else {
4840  n->Cut(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
4841  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1(), &dest);
4842  }
4843 #endif
4844  if (dest) {
4845  dest->SetChannel(n->GetChannel());
4846  dest->SetLinked(n->GetLinked());
4847  dest->SetName(n->GetName());
4848  dest->SetOffset(wxMax(newt0, offset));
4849  mTracks->Add(dest);
4850  }
4851  }
4852 
4853  if (n == l) {
4854  break;
4855  }
4856  }
4857 
4858  PushState(_("Split to new track"), _("Split New"));
4859 
4860  RedrawProject();
4861 }
4862 
4863 void AudacityProject::OnSelectAll()
4864 {
4865  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
4866 
4867  Track *t = iter.First();
4868  while (t) {
4869  t->SetSelected(true);
4870  t = iter.Next();
4871  }
4872  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setTimes(
4873  mTracks->GetMinOffset(), mTracks->GetEndTime());
4874 
4875  ModifyState(false);
4876 
4877  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
4878  if (mMixerBoard)
4879  mMixerBoard->Refresh(false);
4880 }
4881

4883 {
4884  this->SelectNone();
4885  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.collapseToT0();
4886  ModifyState(false);
4887 }

4896 
4897 void AudacityProject::DoNextPeakFrequency(bool up)
4898 {
4899  // Find the first selected wave track that is in a spectrogram view.
4900  WaveTrack *pTrack = 0;
4901  SelectedTrackListOfKindIterator iter(Track::Wave, mTracks);
4902  for (Track *t = iter.First(); t; t = iter.Next()) {
4903  WaveTrack *const wt = static_cast<WaveTrack*>(t);
4904  const int display = wt->GetDisplay();
4905  if (display == WaveTrack::Spectrum) {
4906  pTrack = wt;
4907  break;
4908  }
4909  }
4910 
4911  if (pTrack) {
4912  mTrackPanel->SnapCenterOnce(pTrack, up);
4913  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
4914  ModifyState(false);
4915  }
4916 }
4917 
4918 void AudacityProject::OnNextHigherPeakFrequency()
4919 {
4920  DoNextPeakFrequency(true);
4921 }
4922 
4923 
4924 void AudacityProject::OnNextLowerPeakFrequency()
4925 {
4926  DoNextPeakFrequency(false);
4927 }
4928 #endif
4929 
4930 void AudacityProject::OnSelectCursorEnd()
4931 {
4932  double maxEndOffset = -1000000.0;
4933 
4934  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
4935  Track *t = iter.First();
4936 
4937  while (t) {
4938  if (t->GetSelected()) {
4939  if (t->GetEndTime() > maxEndOffset)
4940  maxEndOffset = t->GetEndTime();
4941  }
4942 
4943  t = iter.Next();
4944  }
4945 
4946  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT1(maxEndOffset);
4947 
4948  ModifyState(false);
4949 
4950  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
4951 }
4952 
4953 void AudacityProject::OnSelectStartCursor()
4954 {
4955  double minOffset = 1000000.0;
4956 
4957  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
4958  Track *t = iter.First();
4959 
4960  while (t) {
4961  if (t->GetSelected()) {
4962  if (t->GetOffset() < minOffset)
4963  minOffset = t->GetOffset();
4964  }
4965 
4966  t = iter.Next();
4967  }
4968 
4969  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT0(minOffset);
4970 
4971  ModifyState(false);
4972 
4973  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
4974 }
4975 
4976 void AudacityProject::OnSelectSyncLockSel()
4977 {
4978  bool selected = false;
4979  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
4980  for (Track *t = iter.First(); t; t = iter.Next())
4981  {
4982  if (t->IsSyncLockSelected()) {
4983  t->SetSelected(true);
4984  selected = true;
4985  }
4986  }
4987 
4988  if (selected)
4989  ModifyState(false);
4990 
4991  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
4992  if (mMixerBoard)
4993  mMixerBoard->Refresh(false);
4994 }
4995

4999  for (Track *t = iter.First(); t; t = iter.Next()) {
5000  t->SetSelected(true);
5001  }
5002 
5003  ModifyState(false);
5004 
5005  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
5006  if (mMixerBoard)
5007  mMixerBoard->Refresh(false);
5008 }

5010 //

5013 
5014 void AudacityProject::OnZoomIn()
5015 {
5016  ZoomInByFactor( 2.0 );
5017 }
5018 
5019 double AudacityProject::GetScreenEndTime() const
5020 {
5021  return mTrackPanel->GetScreenEndTime();
5022 }
5023 
5024 void AudacityProject::ZoomInByFactor( double ZoomFactor )
5025 {
5026  // LLL: Handling positioning differently when audio is active
5027  if (gAudioIO->IsStreamActive(GetAudioIOToken()) != 0) {
5028  ZoomBy(ZoomFactor);
5029  mTrackPanel->ScrollIntoView(gAudioIO->GetStreamTime());
5030  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
5031  return;
5032  }
5033 
5034  // DMM: Here's my attempt to get logical zooming behavior
5035  // when there's a selection that's currently at least
5036  // partially on-screen
5037 
5038  const double endTime = GetScreenEndTime();
5039  const double duration = endTime - mViewInfo.h;
5040 
5041  bool selectionIsOnscreen =
5042  (mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0() < endTime) &&
5043  (mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1() >= mViewInfo.h);
5044 
5045  bool selectionFillsScreen =
5046  (mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0() < mViewInfo.h) &&
5047  (mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1() > endTime);
5048 
5049  if (selectionIsOnscreen && !selectionFillsScreen) {
5050  // Start with the center of the selection
5051  double selCenter = (mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0() +
5052  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1()) / 2;
5053 
5054  // If the selection center is off-screen, pick the
5055  // center of the part that is on-screen.
5056  if (selCenter < mViewInfo.h)
5057  selCenter = mViewInfo.h +
5058  (mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1() - mViewInfo.h) / 2;
5059  if (selCenter > endTime)
5060  selCenter = endTime -
5061  (endTime - mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0()) / 2;
5062 
5063  // Zoom in
5064  ZoomBy(ZoomFactor);
5065  const double newDuration = GetScreenEndTime() - mViewInfo.h;
5066 
5067  // Recenter on selCenter
5068  TP_ScrollWindow(selCenter - newDuration / 2);
5069  return;
5070  }
5071 
5072 
5073  double origLeft = mViewInfo.h;
5074  double origWidth = duration;
5075  ZoomBy(ZoomFactor);
5076 
5077  const double newDuration = GetScreenEndTime() - mViewInfo.h;
5078  double newh = origLeft + (origWidth - newDuration) / 2;
5079 
5080  // MM: Commented this out because it was confusing users
5081  /*
5082  // make sure that the *right-hand* end of the selection is
5083  // no further *left* than 1/3 of the way across the screen
5084  if (mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1() < newh + mViewInfo.screen / 3)
5085  newh = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1() - mViewInfo.screen / 3;
5086 
5087  // make sure that the *left-hand* end of the selection is
5088  // no further *right* than 2/3 of the way across the screen
5089  if (mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0() > newh + mViewInfo.screen * 2 / 3)
5090  newh = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0() - mViewInfo.screen * 2 / 3;
5091  */
5092 
5093  TP_ScrollWindow(newh);
5094 }
5095 
5096 void AudacityProject::OnZoomOut()
5097 {
5098  ZoomOutByFactor( 1 /2.0 );
5099 }
5100 
5101 
5102 void AudacityProject::ZoomOutByFactor( double ZoomFactor )
5103 {
5104  //Zoom() may change these, so record original values:
5105  const double origLeft = mViewInfo.h;
5106  const double origWidth = GetScreenEndTime() - origLeft;
5107 
5108  ZoomBy(ZoomFactor);
5109  const double newWidth = GetScreenEndTime() - mViewInfo.h;
5110 
5111  const double newh = origLeft + (origWidth - newWidth) / 2;
5112  // newh = (newh > 0) ? newh : 0;
5113  TP_ScrollWindow(newh);
5114 
5115 }
5116 
5117 // this is unused:
5118 #if 0
5119 static double OldZooms[2]={ 44100.0/512.0, 4410.0/512.0 };
5120 void AudacityProject::OnZoomToggle()
5121 {
5122  double origLeft = mViewInfo.h;
5123  double origWidth = mViewInfo.screen;
5124 
5125  float f;
5126  // look at percentage difference. We add a small fudge factor
5127  // to avoid testing for zero divisor.
5128  f = mViewInfo.zoom / (OldZooms[0] + 0.0001f);
5129  // If old zoom is more than 10 percent different, use it.
5130  if( (0.90f > f) || (f >1.10) ){
5131  OldZooms[1]=OldZooms[0];
5132  OldZooms[0]=mViewInfo.zoom;
5133  }
5134  Zoom( OldZooms[1] );
5135  double newh = origLeft + (origWidth - mViewInfo.screen) / 2;
5136  TP_ScrollWindow(newh);
5137 }
5138 #endif
5139 
5140 
5141 void AudacityProject::OnZoomNormal()
5142 {
5143  Zoom(ZoomInfo::GetDefaultZoom());
5144  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
5145 }
5146 
5147 void AudacityProject::OnZoomFit()
5148 {
5149  const double end = mTracks->GetEndTime();
5150  const double start = mViewInfo.bScrollBeyondZero
5151  ? std::min(mTracks->GetStartTime(), 0.0)
5152  : 0;
5153  const double len = end - start;
5154 
5155  if (len <= 0.0)
5156  return;
5157 
5158  int w;
5159  mTrackPanel->GetTracksUsableArea(&w, NULL);
5160  w -= 10;
5161 
5162  Zoom(w / len);
5163  TP_ScrollWindow(start);
5164 }
5165 
5166 void AudacityProject::DoZoomFitV()
5167 {
5168  int height, count;
5169 
5170  mTrackPanel->GetTracksUsableArea(NULL, &height);
5171 
5172  height -= 28;
5173 
5174  count = 0;
5175  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
5176  Track *t = iter.First();
5177  while (t) {
5178  if ((t->GetKind() == Track::Wave) &&
5179  !t->GetMinimized())
5180  count++;
5181  else
5182  height -= t->GetHeight();
5183 
5184  t = iter.Next();
5185  }
5186 
5187  if (count == 0)
5188  return;
5189 
5190  height = height / count;
5191 
5192  if (height < 40)
5193  height = 40;
5194 
5195  TrackListIterator iter2(mTracks);
5196  t = iter2.First();
5197  while (t) {
5198  if ((t->GetKind() == Track::Wave) &&
5199  !t->GetMinimized())
5200  t->SetHeight(height);
5201  t = iter2.Next();
5202  }
5203 }
5204 
5205 void AudacityProject::OnZoomFitV()
5206 {
5207  this->DoZoomFitV();
5208 
5209  mVsbar->SetThumbPosition(0);
5210  RedrawProject();
5211  ModifyState(true);
5212 }
5213 
5214 void AudacityProject::OnZoomSel()
5215 {
5216  const double lowerBound =
5217  std::max(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(), ScrollingLowerBoundTime());
5218  const double denom =
5219  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1() - lowerBound;
5220  if (denom <= 0.0)
5221  return;
5222 
5223  // LL: The "-1" is just a hack to get around an issue where zooming to
5224  // selection doesn't actually get the entire selected region within the
5225  // visible area. This causes a problem with scrolling at end of playback
5226  // where the selected region may be scrolled off the left of the screen.
5227  // I know this isn't right, but until the real rounding or 1-off issue is
5228  // found, this will have to work.
5229  // PRL: Did I fix this? I am not sure, so I leave the hack in place.
5230  // Fixes might have resulted from commits
5231  // 1b8f44d0537d987c59653b11ed75a842b48896ea and
5232  // e7c7bb84a966c3b3cc4b3a9717d5f247f25e7296
5233  int width;
5234  mTrackPanel->GetTracksUsableArea(&width, NULL);
5235  Zoom((width - 1) / denom);
5236  TP_ScrollWindow(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0());
5237 }
5238 
5239 void AudacityProject::OnGoSelStart()
5240 {
5241  if (mViewInfo.selectedRegion.isPoint())
5242  return;
5243 
5244  TP_ScrollWindow(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0() - ((GetScreenEndTime() - mViewInfo.h) / 2));
5245 }
5246 
5247 void AudacityProject::OnGoSelEnd()
5248 {
5249  if (mViewInfo.selectedRegion.isPoint())
5250  return;
5251 
5252  TP_ScrollWindow(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1() - ((GetScreenEndTime() - mViewInfo.h) / 2));
5253 }

5255 void AudacityProject::OnShowClipping()
5256 {
5257  bool checked = !gPrefs->Read(wxT("/GUI/ShowClipping"), 0L);
5258  gPrefs->Write(wxT("/GUI/ShowClipping"), checked);
5259  gPrefs->Flush();
5260  mCommandManager.Check(wxT("ShowClipping"), checked);
5261  mTrackPanel->UpdatePrefs();
5262  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
5263 }

5272 }

5295 void AudacityProject::OnPlotSpectrum()
5296 {
5297  if (!mFreqWindow) {
5298  wxPoint where;
5299 
5300  where.x = 150;
5301  where.y = 150;
5302 
5303  mFreqWindow = new FreqWindow(this, -1, _("Frequency Analysis"), where);
5304  }
5305 
5306  mFreqWindow->Show(true);
5307  mFreqWindow->Raise();
5308  mFreqWindow->SetFocus();
5309 }
5310 
5311 void AudacityProject::OnContrast()
5312 {
5313  // All of this goes away when the Contrast Dialog is converted to a module
5314  if(!mContrastDialog)
5315  {
5316  wxPoint where;
5317 
5318  where.x = 150;
5319  where.y = 150;
5320 
5321  mContrastDialog = new ContrastDialog(this, -1, _("Contrast Analysis (WCAG 2 compliance)"), where);
5322 
5323  mContrastDialog->bFGset = false;
5324  mContrastDialog->bBGset = false;
5325  }
5326 
5327  // Zero dialog boxes. Do we need to do this here?
5328  if( !mContrastDialog->bFGset )
5329  {
5330  mContrastDialog->mForegroundStartT->SetValue(0.0);
5331  mContrastDialog->mForegroundEndT->SetValue(0.0);
5332  }
5333  if( !mContrastDialog->bBGset )
5334  {
5335  mContrastDialog->mBackgroundStartT->SetValue(0.0);
5336  mContrastDialog->mBackgroundEndT->SetValue(0.0);
5337  }
5338 
5339  mContrastDialog->CentreOnParent();
5340  mContrastDialog->Show();
5341 }
5342 
5343

5348 }

5365  {

5367  mToolManager->Expose( RecordMeterBarID, false );
5368  }
5369  mToolManager->ShowHide( MeterBarID );
5370  ModifyToolbarMenus();
5371 }
