5429 }
5430 
5431 //
5432 // Project Menu
5433 //
5434 
5435 void AudacityProject::OnImport()
5436 {
5437  // An import trigger for the alias missing dialog might not be intuitive, but
5438  // this serves to track the file if the users zooms in and such.
5439  wxGetApp().SetMissingAliasedFileWarningShouldShow(true);
5440 
5441  wxArrayString selectedFiles = ShowOpenDialog(wxT(""));
5442  if (selectedFiles.GetCount() == 0) {
5443  gPrefs->Write(wxT("/LastOpenType"),wxT(""));
5444  gPrefs->Flush();
5445  return;
5446  }
5447 
5448  gPrefs->Write(wxT("/NewImportingSession"), true);
5449 
5450  //sort selected files by OD status. Load non OD first so user can edit asap.
5451  //first sort selectedFiles.
5452  selectedFiles.Sort(CompareNoCaseFileName);
5453  ODManager::Pause();
5454 
5455  for (size_t ff = 0; ff < selectedFiles.GetCount(); ff++) {
5456  wxString fileName = selectedFiles[ff];
5457 
5458  wxString path = ::wxPathOnly(fileName);
5459  gPrefs->Write(wxT("/DefaultOpenPath"), path);
5460 
5461  Import(fileName);
5462  }
5463 
5464  gPrefs->Write(wxT("/LastOpenType"),wxT(""));
5465 
5466  gPrefs->Flush();
5467 
5468  HandleResize(); // Adjust scrollers for NEW track sizes.
5469  ODManager::Resume();
5470 }
5471 
5472 void AudacityProject::OnImportLabels()
5473 {
5474  wxString path = gPrefs->Read(wxT("/DefaultOpenPath"),::wxGetCwd());
5475 
5476  wxString fileName =
5477  FileSelector(_("Select a text file containing labels..."),
5478  path, // Path
5479  wxT(""), // Name
5480  wxT(".txt"), // Extension
5481  _("Text files (*.txt)|*.txt|All files|*"),
5482  wxRESIZE_BORDER, // Flags
5483  this); // Parent
5484 
5485  if (fileName != wxT("")) {
5486  path =::wxPathOnly(fileName);
5487  gPrefs->Write(wxT("/DefaultOpenPath"), path);
5488  gPrefs->Flush();
5489 
5490  wxTextFile f;
5491 
5492  f.Open(fileName);
5493  if (!f.IsOpened()) {
5494  wxMessageBox(_("Could not open file: ") + fileName);
5495  return;
5496  }
5497 
5498  LabelTrack *newTrack = new LabelTrack(mDirManager);
5499  wxString sTrackName;
5500  wxFileName::SplitPath(fileName, NULL, NULL, &sTrackName, NULL);
5501  newTrack->SetName(sTrackName);
5502 
5503  newTrack->Import(f);
5504 
5505  SelectNone();
5506  mTracks->Add(newTrack);
5507  newTrack->SetSelected(true);
5508 
5509  PushState(wxString::
5510  Format(_("Imported labels from '%s'"), fileName.c_str()),
5511  _("Import Labels"));
5512 
5513  RedrawProject();
5514  }
5515 }
5516 
5517 #ifdef USE_MIDI
5518 void AudacityProject::OnImportMIDI()
5519 {
5520  wxString path = gPrefs->Read(wxT("/DefaultOpenPath"),::wxGetCwd());
5521 
5522  wxString fileName = FileSelector(_("Select a MIDI file..."),
5523  path, // Path
5524  wxT(""), // Name
5525  wxT(""), // Extension
5526  _("MIDI and Allegro files (*.mid;*.midi;*.gro)|*.mid;*.midi;*.gro|MIDI files (*.mid;*.midi)|*.mid;*.midi|Allegro files (*.gro)|*.gro|All files|*"),
5527  wxRESIZE_BORDER, // Flags
5528  this); // Parent
5529 
5530  if (fileName != wxT("")) {
5531  path =::wxPathOnly(fileName);
5532  gPrefs->Write(wxT("/DefaultOpenPath"), path);
5533  gPrefs->Flush();
5534 
5535  DoImportMIDI(fileName);
5536  }
5537 }
5538 
5539 void AudacityProject::DoImportMIDI(const wxString &fileName)
5540 {
5541  NoteTrack *newTrack = new NoteTrack(mDirManager);
5542 
5543  if (::ImportMIDI(fileName, newTrack)) {
5544 
5545  SelectNone();
5546  mTracks->Add(newTrack);
5547  newTrack->SetSelected(true);
5548 
5549  PushState(wxString::Format(_("Imported MIDI from '%s'"),
5550  fileName.c_str()), _("Import MIDI"));
5551 
5552  RedrawProject();
5553  mTrackPanel->EnsureVisible(newTrack);
5554  }
5555  else
5556  delete newTrack;
5557 }
5558 #endif // USE_MIDI
5559 
5560 void AudacityProject::OnImportRaw()
5561 {
5562  wxString path = gPrefs->Read(wxT("/DefaultOpenPath"),::wxGetCwd());
5563 
5564  wxString fileName =
5565  FileSelector(_("Select any uncompressed audio file..."),
5566  path, // Path
5567  wxT(""), // Name
5568  wxT(""), // Extension
5569  _("All files|*"),
5570  wxRESIZE_BORDER, // Flags
5571  this); // Parent
5572 
5573  if (fileName == wxT(""))
5574  return;
5575 
5576  path =::wxPathOnly(fileName);
5577  gPrefs->Write(wxT("/DefaultOpenPath"), path);
5578  gPrefs->Flush();
5579 
5580  Track **newTracks;
5581  int numTracks;
5582 
5583  numTracks = ::ImportRaw(this, fileName, mTrackFactory, &newTracks);
5584 
5585  if (numTracks <= 0)
5586  return;
5587 
5588  AddImportedTracks(fileName, newTracks, numTracks);
5589  HandleResize(); // Adjust scrollers for NEW track sizes.
5590 }
5591 
5592 void AudacityProject::OnEditMetadata()
5593 {
5594  (void)DoEditMetadata(_("Edit Metadata Tags"), _("Metadata Tags"), true);
5595 }
5596 
5597 bool AudacityProject::DoEditMetadata
5598 (const wxString &title, const wxString &shortUndoDescription, bool force)
5599 {
5600  // Back up my tags
5601  auto newTags = mTags->Duplicate();
5602 
5603  if (newTags->ShowEditDialog(this, title, force)) {
5604  // Commit the change to project state only now.
5605  mTags = newTags;
5606  PushState(title, shortUndoDescription);
5607 
5608  return true;
5609  }
5610 
5611  return false;
5612 }
5613 
5614 void AudacityProject::HandleMixAndRender(bool toNewTrack)
5615 {
5616  WaveTrack *newLeft = NULL;
5617  WaveTrack *newRight = NULL;
5618 
5619  wxGetApp().SetMissingAliasedFileWarningShouldShow(true);
5620 
5621  if (::MixAndRender(mTracks, mTrackFactory, mRate, mDefaultFormat, 0.0, 0.0,
5622  &newLeft, &newRight)) {
5623 
5624  // Remove originals, get stats on what tracks were mixed
5625 
5626  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
5627  Track *t = iter.First();
5628  int selectedCount = 0;
5629  wxString firstName;
5630 
5631  while (t) {
5632  if (t->GetSelected() && (t->GetKind() == Track::Wave)) {
5633  if (selectedCount==0)
5634  firstName = t->GetName();
5635 
5636  // Add one to the count if it's an unlinked track, or if it's the first
5637  // in a stereo pair
5638  if (t->GetLinked() || !t->GetLink())
5639  selectedCount++;
5640 
5641  if (!toNewTrack) {
5642  t = iter.RemoveCurrent(true);
5643  } else {
5644  t = iter.Next();
5645  };
5646  }
5647  else
5648  t = iter.Next();
5649  }
5650 
5651  // Add NEW tracks
5652 
5653  mTracks->Add(newLeft);
5654  if (newRight)
5655  mTracks->Add(newRight);
5656 
5657  // If we're just rendering (not mixing), keep the track name the same
5658  if (selectedCount==1) {
5659  newLeft->SetName(firstName);
5660  if (newRight)
5661  newRight->SetName(firstName);
5662  }
5663 
5664  // Smart history/undo message
5665  if (selectedCount==1) {
5666  wxString msg;
5667  msg.Printf(_("Rendered all audio in track '%s'"), firstName.c_str());
5668  /* i18n-hint: Convert the audio into a more usable form, so apply
5669  * panning and amplification and write to some external file.*/
5670  PushState(msg, _("Render"));
5671  }
5672  else {
5673  wxString msg;
5674  if (newRight)
5675  msg.Printf(_("Mixed and rendered %d tracks into one new stereo track"),
5676  selectedCount);
5677  else
5678  msg.Printf(_("Mixed and rendered %d tracks into one new mono track"),
5679  selectedCount);
5680  PushState(msg, _("Mix and Render"));
5681  }
5682 
5683  mTrackPanel->SetFocus();
5684  mTrackPanel->SetFocusedTrack(newLeft);
5685  mTrackPanel->EnsureVisible(newLeft);
5686  RedrawProject();
5687  }
5688 }
5689 
5690 void AudacityProject::OnMixAndRender()
5691 {
5692  HandleMixAndRender(false);
5693 }
5694 
5695 void AudacityProject::OnMixAndRenderToNewTrack()
5696 {
5697  HandleMixAndRender(true);
5698 }
5699 
5700 void AudacityProject::OnSelectionSave()
5701 {
5702  mRegionSave = mViewInfo.selectedRegion;
5703 }
5704 
5705 void AudacityProject::OnSelectionRestore()
5706 {
5707  if ((mRegionSave.t0() == 0.0) &&
5708  (mRegionSave.t1() == 0.0))
5709  return;
5710 
5711  mViewInfo.selectedRegion = mRegionSave;
5712 
5713  ModifyState(false);
5714 
5715  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
5716 }
5717 
5718 void AudacityProject::OnCursorTrackStart()
5719 {
5720  double minOffset = 1000000.0;
5721 
5722  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
5723  Track *t = iter.First();
5724 
5725  while (t) {
5726  if (t->GetSelected()) {
5727  if (t->GetOffset() < minOffset)
5728  minOffset = t->GetOffset();
5729  }
5730 
5731  t = iter.Next();
5732  }
5733 
5734  if (minOffset < 0.0) minOffset = 0.0;
5735  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setTimes(minOffset, minOffset);
5736  ModifyState(false);
5737  mTrackPanel->ScrollIntoView(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0());
5738  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
5739 }
5740 
5741 void AudacityProject::OnCursorTrackEnd()
5742 {
5743  double maxEndOffset = -1000000.0;
5744  double thisEndOffset = 0.0;
5745 
5746  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
5747  Track *t = iter.First();
5748 
5749  while (t) {
5750  if (t->GetSelected()) {
5751  thisEndOffset = t->GetEndTime();
5752  if (thisEndOffset > maxEndOffset)
5753  maxEndOffset = thisEndOffset;
5754  }
5755 
5756  t = iter.Next();
5757  }
5758 
5759  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setTimes(maxEndOffset, maxEndOffset);
5760  ModifyState(false);
5761  mTrackPanel->ScrollIntoView(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
5762  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
5763 }
5764 
5765 void AudacityProject::OnCursorSelStart()
5766 {
5767  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.collapseToT0();
5768  ModifyState(false);
5769  mTrackPanel->ScrollIntoView(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0());
5770  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
5771 }
5772 
5773 void AudacityProject::OnCursorSelEnd()
5774 {
5775  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.collapseToT1();
5776  ModifyState(false);
5777  mTrackPanel->ScrollIntoView(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
5778  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
5779 }
5780 
5781 void AudacityProject::HandleAlign(int index, bool moveSel)
5782 {
5783  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
5784  wxString action;
5785  wxString shortAction;
5786  double offset;
5787  double minOffset = 1000000000.0;
5788  double maxEndOffset = 0.0;
5789  double leftOffset = 0.0;
5790  bool bRightChannel = false;
5791  double avgOffset = 0.0;
5792  int numSelected = 0;
5793  Track *t = iter.First();
5794  double delta = 0.0;
5795  double newPos = -1.0;
5796  wxArrayDouble trackStartArray;
5797  wxArrayDouble trackEndArray;
5798  double firstTrackOffset=0.0f;
5799 
5800  while (t) {
5801  // We only want Wave and Note tracks here.
5802 #if defined(USE_MIDI)
5803  if (t->GetSelected() && ((t->GetKind() == Track::Wave) ||
5804  (t->GetKind() == Track::Note))) {
5805 #else
5806  if (t->GetSelected() && (t->GetKind() == Track::Wave)) {
5807 #endif
5808  offset = t->GetOffset();
5809  if (t->GetLinked()) { // Left channel of stereo track.
5810  leftOffset = offset;
5811  bRightChannel = true; // next track is the right channel.
5812  } else {
5813  if (bRightChannel) {
5814  // Align channel with earlier start time
5815  offset = (offset < leftOffset)? offset : leftOffset;
5816  leftOffset = 0.0;
5817  bRightChannel = false;
5818  }
5819  avgOffset += offset;
5820  if (numSelected == 0) {
5821  firstTrackOffset = offset; // For Align End to End.
5822  }
5823  numSelected++;
5824  }
5825  trackStartArray.Add(t->GetStartTime());
5826  trackEndArray.Add(t->GetEndTime());
5827 
5828  if (offset < minOffset)
5829  minOffset = offset;
5830  if (t->GetEndTime() > maxEndOffset)
5831  maxEndOffset = t->GetEndTime();
5832  }
5833  t = iter.Next();
5834  }
5835 
5836  avgOffset /= numSelected; // numSelected is mono/stereo tracks not channels.
5837 
5838  switch(index) {
5839  case kAlignStartZero:
5840  delta = -minOffset;
5841  action = _("start to zero");
5842  shortAction = _("Start");
5843  break;
5844  case kAlignStartSelStart:
5845  delta = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0() - minOffset;
5846  action = _("start to cursor/selection start");
5847  shortAction = _("Start");
5848  break;
5849  case kAlignStartSelEnd:
5850  delta = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1() - minOffset;
5851  action = _("start to selection end");
5852  shortAction = _("Start");
5853  break;
5854  case kAlignEndSelStart:
5855  delta = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0() - maxEndOffset;
5856  action = _("end to cursor/selection start");
5857  shortAction = _("End");
5858  break;
5859  case kAlignEndSelEnd:
5860  delta = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1() - maxEndOffset;
5861  action = _("end to selection end");
5862  shortAction = _("End");
5863  break;
5864  // index set in alignLabelsNoSync
5865  case kAlignEndToEnd:
5866  newPos = firstTrackOffset;
5867  action = _("end to end");
5868  shortAction = _("End to End");
5869  break;
5870  case kAlignTogether:
5871  newPos = avgOffset;
5872  action = _("together");
5873  shortAction = _("Together");
5874  }
5875 
5876  if ((unsigned)index >= mAlignLabelsCount) { // This is an alignLabelsNoSync command.
5877  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
5878  Track *t = iter.First();
5879  double leftChannelStart = 0.0;
5880  double leftChannelEnd = 0.0;
5881  double rightChannelStart = 0.0;
5882  double rightChannelEnd = 0.0;
5883  int arrayIndex = 0;
5884  while (t) {
5885  // This shifts different tracks in different ways, so no sync-lock move.
5886  // Only align Wave and Note tracks end to end.
5887 #if defined(USE_MIDI)
5888  if (t->GetSelected() && ((t->GetKind() == Track::Wave) ||
5889  (t->GetKind() == Track::Note))) {
5890 #else
5891  if (t->GetSelected() && (t->GetKind() == Track::Wave)) {
5892 #endif
5893  t->SetOffset(newPos); // Move the track
5894 
5895  if (t->GetLinked()) { // Left channel of stereo track.
5896  leftChannelStart = trackStartArray[arrayIndex];
5897  leftChannelEnd = trackEndArray[arrayIndex];
5898  rightChannelStart = trackStartArray[1+arrayIndex];
5899  rightChannelEnd = trackEndArray[1+arrayIndex];
5900  bRightChannel = true; // next track is the right channel.
5901  // newPos is the offset for the earlier channel.
5902  // If right channel started first, offset the left channel.
5903  if (rightChannelStart < leftChannelStart) {
5904  t->SetOffset(newPos + leftChannelStart - rightChannelStart);
5905  }
5906  arrayIndex++;
5907  } else {
5908  if (bRightChannel) {
5909  // If left channel started first, offset the right channel.
5910  if (leftChannelStart < rightChannelStart) {
5911  t->SetOffset(newPos + rightChannelStart - leftChannelStart);
5912  }
5913  if (index == kAlignEndToEnd) {
5914  // Now set position for start of next track.
5915  newPos += wxMax(leftChannelEnd, rightChannelEnd) - wxMin(leftChannelStart, rightChannelStart);
5916  }
5917  bRightChannel = false;
5918  } else { // Mono track
5919  if (index == kAlignEndToEnd) {
5920  newPos += (trackEndArray[arrayIndex] - trackStartArray[arrayIndex]);
5921  }
5922  }
5923  arrayIndex++;
5924  }
5925  }
5926  t = iter.Next();
5927  }
5928  if (index == kAlignEndToEnd) {
5929  OnZoomFit();
5930  }
5931  }
5932 
5933  if (delta != 0.0) {
5934  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
5935  Track *t = iter.First();
5936 
5937  while (t) {
5938  // For a fixed-distance shift move sync-lock selected tracks also.
5939  if (t->GetSelected() || t->IsSyncLockSelected()) {
5940  t->SetOffset(t->GetOffset() + delta);
5941  }
5942  t = iter.Next();
5943  }
5944  }
5945 
5946  if (moveSel) {
5947  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.move(delta);
5948  action = wxString::Format(_("Aligned/Moved %s"), action.c_str());
5949  shortAction = wxString::Format(_("Align %s/Move"),shortAction.c_str());
5950  PushState(action, shortAction);
5951  } else {
5952  action = wxString::Format(_("Aligned %s"), action.c_str());
5953  shortAction = wxString::Format(_("Align %s"),shortAction.c_str());
5954  PushState(action, shortAction);
5955  }
5956 
5957  RedrawProject();
5958 }
5959 
5960 void AudacityProject::OnAlignNoSync(int index)
5961 {
5962  // Add length of alignLabels array so that we can handle this in AudacityProject::HandleAlign.
5963  HandleAlign(index + mAlignLabelsCount, false);
5964 }
5965 
5966 void AudacityProject::OnAlign(int index)
5967 {
5968  HandleAlign(index, false);
5969 }
5970 
5971 void AudacityProject::OnAlignMoveSel(int index)
5972 {
5973  HandleAlign(index, true);
5974 }
5975 
5976 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SCOREALIGN
5977 // rough relative amount of time to compute one
5978 // frame of audio or midi, or one cell of matrix, or one iteration
5979 // of smoothing, measured on a 1.9GHz Core 2 Duo in 32-bit mode
5980 // (see COLLECT_TIMING_DATA below)
5981 #define AUDIO_WORK_UNIT 0.004F
5982 #define MIDI_WORK_UNIT 0.0001F
5983 #define MATRIX_WORK_UNIT 0.000002F
5984 #define SMOOTHING_WORK_UNIT 0.000001F
5985 
5986 // Write timing data to a file; useful for calibrating AUDIO_WORK_UNIT,
5987 // MIDI_WORK_UNIT, MATRIX_WORK_UNIT, and SMOOTHING_WORK_UNIT coefficients
5988 // Data is written to timing-data.txt; look in
5989 // audacity-src/win/Release/modules/
5990 #define COLLECT_TIMING_DATA
5991 
5992 // Audacity Score Align Progress class -- progress reports come here
5993 class ASAProgress final : public SAProgress {
5994  private:
5995  float mTotalWork;
5996  float mFrames[2];
5997  long mTotalCells; // how many matrix cells?
5998  long mCellCount; // how many cells so far?
5999  long mPrevCellCount; // cell_count last reported with Update()
6000  ProgressDialog *mProgress;
6001  #ifdef COLLECT_TIMING_DATA
6002  FILE *mTimeFile;
6003  wxDateTime mStartTime;
6004  long iterations;
6005  #endif
6006 
6007  public:
6008  ASAProgress() {
6009  smoothing = false;
6010  mProgress = NULL;
6011  #ifdef COLLECT_TIMING_DATA
6012  mTimeFile = fopen("timing-data.txt", "w");
6013  #endif
6014  }
6015  ~ASAProgress() {
6016  delete mProgress;
6017  #ifdef COLLECT_TIMING_DATA
6018  fclose(mTimeFile);
6019  #endif
6020  }
6021  void set_phase(int i) override {
6022  float work[2]; // chromagram computation work estimates
6023  float work2, work3 = 0; // matrix and smoothing work estimates
6024  SAProgress::set_phase(i);
6025  #ifdef COLLECT_TIMING_DATA
6026  long ms = 0;
6027  wxDateTime now = wxDateTime::UNow();
6028  fprintf(mTimeFile, "Phase %d begins at %s\n",
6029  i, now.FormatTime().c_str());
6030  if (i != 0)
6031  ms = now.Subtract(mStartTime).GetMilliseconds().ToLong();
6032  mStartTime = now;
6033  #endif
6034  if (i == 0) {
6035  mCellCount = 0;
6036  for (int j = 0; j < 2; j++) {
6037  mFrames[j] = durations[j] / frame_period;
6038  }
6039  mTotalWork = 0;
6040  for (int j = 0; j < 2; j++) {
6041  work[j] =
6042  (is_audio[j] ? AUDIO_WORK_UNIT : MIDI_WORK_UNIT) * mFrames[j];
6043  mTotalWork += work[j];
6044  }
6045  mTotalCells = mFrames[0] * mFrames[1];
6046  work2 = mTotalCells * MATRIX_WORK_UNIT;
6047  mTotalWork += work2;
6048  // arbitarily assume 60 iterations to fit smooth segments and
6049  // per frame per iteration is SMOOTHING_WORK_UNIT
6050  if (smoothing) {
6051  work3 =
6052  wxMax(mFrames[0], mFrames[1]) * SMOOTHING_WORK_UNIT * 40;
6053  mTotalWork += work3;
6054  }
6055  #ifdef COLLECT_TIMING_DATA
6056  fprintf(mTimeFile, " mTotalWork (an estimate) = %g\n", mTotalWork);
6057  fprintf(mTimeFile, " work0 = %g, frames %g, is_audio %d\n",
6058  work[0], mFrames[0], is_audio[0]);
6059  fprintf(mTimeFile, " work1 = %g, frames %g, is_audio %d\n",
6060  work[1], mFrames[1], is_audio[1]);
6061  fprintf(mTimeFile, "work2 = %g, work3 = %g\n", work2, work3);
6062  #endif
6063  mProgress = new ProgressDialog(_("Synchronize MIDI with Audio"),
6064  _("Synchronizing MIDI and Audio Tracks"));
6065  } else if (i < 3) {
6066  fprintf(mTimeFile,
6067  "Phase %d took %d ms for %g frames, coefficient = %g s/frame\n",
6068  i - 1, ms, mFrames[i - 1], (ms * 0.001) / mFrames[i - 1]);
6069  } else if (i == 3) {
6070  fprintf(mTimeFile,
6071  "Phase 2 took %d ms for %d cells, coefficient = %g s/cell\n",
6072  ms, mCellCount, (ms * 0.001) / mCellCount);
6073  } else if (i == 4) {
6074  fprintf(mTimeFile, "Phase 3 took %d ms for %d iterations on %g frames, coefficient = %g s per frame per iteration\n",
6075  ms, iterations, wxMax(mFrames[0], mFrames[1]),
6076  (ms * 0.001) / (wxMax(mFrames[0], mFrames[1]) * iterations));
6077  }
6078  }
6079  bool set_feature_progress(float s) override {
6080  float work;
6081  if (phase == 0) {
6082  float f = s / frame_period;
6083  work = (is_audio[0] ? AUDIO_WORK_UNIT : MIDI_WORK_UNIT) * f;
6084  } else if (phase == 1) {
6085  float f = s / frame_period;
6086  work = (is_audio[0] ? AUDIO_WORK_UNIT : MIDI_WORK_UNIT) * mFrames[0] +
6087  (is_audio[1] ? AUDIO_WORK_UNIT : MIDI_WORK_UNIT) * f;
6088  }
6089  int updateResult = mProgress->Update(int(work), int(mTotalWork));
6090  return (updateResult == eProgressSuccess);
6091  }
6092  bool set_matrix_progress(int cells) override {
6093  mCellCount += cells;
6094  float work =
6095  (is_audio[0] ? AUDIO_WORK_UNIT : MIDI_WORK_UNIT) * mFrames[0] +
6096  (is_audio[1] ? AUDIO_WORK_UNIT : MIDI_WORK_UNIT) * mFrames[1];
6097  work += mCellCount * MATRIX_WORK_UNIT;
6098  int updateResult = mProgress->Update(int(work), int(mTotalWork));
6099  return (updateResult == eProgressSuccess);
6100  }
6101  bool set_smoothing_progress(int i) override {
6102  iterations = i;
6103  float work =
6104  (is_audio[0] ? AUDIO_WORK_UNIT : MIDI_WORK_UNIT) * mFrames[0] +
6105  (is_audio[1] ? AUDIO_WORK_UNIT : MIDI_WORK_UNIT) * mFrames[1] +
6106  MATRIX_WORK_UNIT * mFrames[0] * mFrames[1];
6107  work += i * wxMax(mFrames[0], mFrames[1]) * SMOOTHING_WORK_UNIT;
6108  int updateResult = mProgress->Update(int(work), int(mTotalWork));
6109  return (updateResult == eProgressSuccess);
6110  }
6111 };
6112 
6113 
6114 long mixer_process(void *mixer, float **buffer, long n)
6115 {
6116  Mixer *mix = (Mixer *) mixer;
6117  long frame_count = mix->Process(n);
6118  *buffer = (float *) mix->GetBuffer();
6119  return frame_count;
6120 }
6121 
6122 void AudacityProject::OnScoreAlign()
6123 {
6124  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
6125  Track *t = iter.First();
6126  int numWaveTracksSelected = 0;
6127  int numNoteTracksSelected = 0;
6128  int numOtherTracksSelected = 0;
6129  NoteTrack *nt;
6130  NoteTrack *alignedNoteTrack;
6131  double endTime = 0.0;
6132 
6133  // Iterate through once to make sure that there is exactly
6134  // one WaveTrack and one NoteTrack selected.
6135  while (t) {
6136  if (t->GetSelected()) {
6137  if (t->GetKind() == Track::Wave) {
6138  numWaveTracksSelected++;
6139  WaveTrack *wt = (WaveTrack *) t;
6140  endTime = endTime > wt->GetEndTime() ? endTime : wt->GetEndTime();
6141  } else if(t->GetKind() == Track::Note) {
6142  numNoteTracksSelected++;
6143  nt = (NoteTrack *) t;
6144  } else numOtherTracksSelected++;
6145  }
6146  t = iter.Next();
6147  }
6148 
6149  if(numWaveTracksSelected == 0 ||
6150  numNoteTracksSelected != 1 ||
6151  numOtherTracksSelected != 0){
6152  wxMessageBox(wxString::Format(wxT("Please select at least one audio track and one MIDI track.")));
6153  return;
6154  }
6155 
6156  // Creating the dialog also stores dialog into gScoreAlignDialog so
6157  // that it can be delted by CloseScoreAlignDialog() either here or
6158  // if the program is quit by the user while the dialog is up.
6159  ScoreAlignParams params;
6160  ScoreAlignDialog *dlog = new ScoreAlignDialog(NULL, params);
6161  CloseScoreAlignDialog();
6162 
6163  if (params.mStatus != wxID_OK) return;
6164 
6165  // We're going to do it.
6166  //pushing the state before the change is wrong (I think)
6167  //PushState(_("Sync MIDI with Audio"), _("Sync MIDI with Audio"));
6168  // Make a copy of the note track in case alignment is canceled or fails
6169  alignedNoteTrack = (NoteTrack *) nt->Duplicate();
6170  // Duplicate() on note tracks serializes seq to a buffer, but we need
6171  // the seq, so Duplicate again and discard the track with buffer. The
6172  // test is here in case Duplicate() is changed in the future.
6173  if (alignedNoteTrack->GetSequence() == NULL) {
6174  NoteTrack *temp = (NoteTrack *) alignedNoteTrack->Duplicate();
6175  delete alignedNoteTrack;
6176  alignedNoteTrack = temp;
6177  assert(alignedNoteTrack->GetSequence());
6178  }
6179  // Remove offset from NoteTrack because audio is
6180  // mixed starting at zero and incorporating clip offsets.
6181  if (alignedNoteTrack->GetOffset() < 0) {
6182  // remove the negative offset data before alignment
6183  nt->Clear(alignedNoteTrack->GetOffset(), 0);
6184  } else if (alignedNoteTrack->GetOffset() > 0) {
6185  alignedNoteTrack->Shift(alignedNoteTrack->GetOffset());
6186  }
6187  alignedNoteTrack->SetOffset(0);
6188 
6189  WaveTrack **waveTracks;
6190  mTracks->GetWaveTracks(true /* selectionOnly */,
6191  &numWaveTracksSelected, &waveTracks);
6192 
6193  int result;
6194  {
6195  Mixer mix(numWaveTracksSelected, // int numInputTracks
6196  waveTracks, // WaveTrack **inputTracks
6197  mTracks->GetTimeTrack(), // TimeTrack *timeTrack
6198  0.0, // double startTime
6199  endTime, // double stopTime
6200  2, // int numOutChannels
6201  44100, // int outBufferSize
6202  true, // bool outInterleaved
6203  mRate, // double outRate
6204  floatSample, // sampleFormat outFormat
6205  true, // bool highQuality = true
6206  NULL); // MixerSpec *mixerSpec = NULL
6207  delete [] waveTracks;
6208 
6209  ASAProgress progress;
6210 
6211  // There's a lot of adjusting made to incorporate the note track offset into
6212  // the note track while preserving the position of notes within beats and
6213  // measures. For debugging, you can see just the pre-scorealign note track
6214  // manipulation by setting SKIP_ACTUAL_SCORE_ALIGNMENT. You could then, for
6215  // example, save the modified note track in ".gro" form to read the details.
6216  //#define SKIP_ACTUAL_SCORE_ALIGNMENT 1
6217 #ifndef SKIP_ACTUAL_SCORE_ALIGNMENT
6218  result = scorealign((void *) &mix, &mixer_process,
6219  2 /* channels */, 44100.0 /* srate */, endTime,
6220  alignedNoteTrack->GetSequence(), &progress, params);
6221 #else
6222  result = SA_SUCCESS;
6223 #endif
6224  }
6225 
6226  if (result == SA_SUCCESS) {
6227  mTracks->Replace(nt, alignedNoteTrack, true);
6228  RedrawProject();
6229  wxMessageBox(wxString::Format(
6230  _("Alignment completed: MIDI from %.2f to %.2f secs, Audio from %.2f to %.2f secs."),
6231  params.mMidiStart, params.mMidiEnd,
6232  params.mAudioStart, params.mAudioEnd));
6233  PushState(_("Sync MIDI with Audio"), _("Sync MIDI with Audio"));
6234  } else if (result == SA_TOOSHORT) {
6235  delete alignedNoteTrack;
6236  wxMessageBox(wxString::Format(
6237  _("Alignment error: input too short: MIDI from %.2f to %.2f secs, Audio from %.2f to %.2f secs."),
6238  params.mMidiStart, params.mMidiEnd,
6239  params.mAudioStart, params.mAudioEnd));
6240  } else if (result == SA_CANCEL) {
6241  // wrong way to recover...
6242  //GetActiveProject()->OnUndo(); // recover any changes to note track
6243  delete alignedNoteTrack;
6244  return; // no message when user cancels alignment
6245  } else {
6246  //GetActiveProject()->OnUndo(); // recover any changes to note track
6247  delete alignedNoteTrack;
6248  wxMessageBox(_("Internal error reported by alignment process."));
6249  }
6250 }
6251 #endif /* EXPERIMENTAL_SCOREALIGN */
6252 
6253 
6254 void AudacityProject::OnNewWaveTrack()
6255 {
6256  WaveTrack *t = mTrackFactory->NewWaveTrack(mDefaultFormat, mRate);
6257  SelectNone();
6258 
6259  mTracks->Add(t);
6260  t->SetSelected(true);
6261 
6262  PushState(_("Created new audio track"), _("New Track"));
6263 
6264  RedrawProject();
6265  mTrackPanel->EnsureVisible(t);
6266 }
6267 
6268 void AudacityProject::OnNewStereoTrack()
6269 {
6270  WaveTrack *t = mTrackFactory->NewWaveTrack(mDefaultFormat, mRate);
6271  t->SetChannel(Track::LeftChannel);
6272  SelectNone();
6273 
6274  mTracks->Add(t);
6275  t->SetSelected(true);
6276  t->SetLinked (true);
6277 
6278  t = mTrackFactory->NewWaveTrack(mDefaultFormat, mRate);
6279  t->SetChannel(Track::RightChannel);
6280 
6281  mTracks->Add(t);
6282  t->SetSelected(true);
6283 
6284  PushState(_("Created new stereo audio track"), _("New Track"));
6285 
6286  RedrawProject();
6287  mTrackPanel->EnsureVisible(t);
6288 }
6289

6291 {
6292  LabelTrack *t = new LabelTrack(mDirManager);
6293 
6294  SelectNone();
6295 
6296  mTracks->Add(t);
6297  t->SetSelected(true);
6298 
6299  PushState(_("Created new label track"), _("New Track"));
6300 
6301  RedrawProject();
6302  mTrackPanel->EnsureVisible(t);
6303 }
6304 
6305 void AudacityProject::OnNewTimeTrack()
6306 {
6307  if (mTracks->GetTimeTrack()) {
6308  wxMessageBox(_("This version of Audacity only allows one time track for each project window."));
6309  return;
6310  }
6311 
6312  TimeTrack *t = mTrackFactory->NewTimeTrack();
6313 
6314  SelectNone();
6315 
6316  mTracks->AddToHead(t);
6317  t->SetSelected(true);
6318 
6319  PushState(_("Created new time track"), _("New Track"));
6320 
6321  RedrawProject();
6322  mTrackPanel->EnsureVisible(t);
6323 }
6324 
6325 void AudacityProject::OnTimerRecord()
6326 {
6327  //we break the prompting and waiting dialogs into two sections
6328  //because they both give the user a chance to click cancel
6329  //and therefore remove the newly inserted track.
6330 
6331  TimerRecordDialog dialog(this /* parent */ );
6332  int modalResult = dialog.ShowModal();
6333  if (modalResult == wxID_CANCEL)
6334  {
6335  // Cancelled before recording - don't need to do anyting.
6336  }
6337  else if(!dialog.RunWaitDialog())
6338  {
6339  //RunWaitDialog() shows the "wait for start" as well as "recording" dialog
6340  //if it returned false it means the user cancelled while the recording, so throw out the fresh track.
6341  //However, we can't undo it here because the PushState() is called in TrackPanel::OnTimer(),
6342  //which is blocked by this function.
6343  //so instead we mark a flag to undo it there.
6344  mTimerRecordCanceled = true;
6345  }
6346 }
6347 
6348 void AudacityProject::OnSoundActivated()
6349 {
6350  SoundActivatedRecord dialog(this /* parent */ );
6351  dialog.ShowModal();
6352 }
6353 
6354 void AudacityProject::OnRescanDevices()
6355 {
6356  DeviceManager::Instance()->Rescan();
6357 }
6358 
6359 int AudacityProject::DoAddLabel(const SelectedRegion &region, bool preserveFocus)
6360 {
6361  LabelTrack *lt = NULL;
6362 
6363  // If the focused track is a label track, use that
6364  Track *const pFocusedTrack = mTrackPanel->GetFocusedTrack();
6365  Track *t = pFocusedTrack;
6366  if (t && t->GetKind() == Track::Label) {
6367  lt = (LabelTrack *) t;
6368  }
6369 
6370  // Otherwise look for a label track after the focused track
6371  if (!lt) {
6372  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
6373  if (t)
6374  iter.StartWith(t);
6375  else
6376  t = iter.First();
6377 
6378  while (t && !lt) {
6379  if (t->GetKind() == Track::Label)
6380  lt = (LabelTrack *) t;
6381 
6382  t = iter.Next();
6383  }
6384  }
6385 
6386  // If none found, start a NEW label track and use it
6387  if (!lt) {
6388  lt = new LabelTrack(mDirManager);
6389  mTracks->Add(lt);
6390  }
6391 
6392 // LLL: Commented as it seemed a little forceful to remove users
6393 // selection when adding the label. This does not happen if
6394 // you select several tracks and the last one of those is a
6395 // label track...typing a label will not clear the selections.
6396 //
6397 // SelectNone();
6398  lt->SetSelected(true);
6399 
6400  int focusTrackNumber = -1;
6401  if (pFocusedTrack && preserveFocus) {
6402  // Must remember the track to re-focus after finishing a label edit.
6403  // do NOT identify it by a pointer, which might dangle! Identify
6404  // by position.
6405  TrackListIterator iter(GetTracks());
6406  Track *track = iter.First();
6407  do
6408  ++focusTrackNumber;
6409  while (track != pFocusedTrack &&
6410  NULL != (track = iter.Next()));
6411  if (!track)
6412  // How could we not find it?
6413  focusTrackNumber = -1;
6414  }
6415 
6416  int index = lt->AddLabel(region, wxString(), focusTrackNumber);
6417 
6418  PushState(_("Added label"), _("Label"));
6419 
6420  RedrawProject();
6421  mTrackPanel->EnsureVisible((Track *)lt);
6422  mTrackPanel->SetFocus();
6423 
6424  return index;
6425 }
6426 
6427 void AudacityProject::OnSyncLock()
6428 {
6429  bool bSyncLockTracks;
6430  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/GUI/SyncLockTracks"), &bSyncLockTracks, false);
6431  gPrefs->Write(wxT("/GUI/SyncLockTracks"), !bSyncLockTracks);
6432  gPrefs->Flush();
6433 
6434  // Toolbar, project sync-lock handled within
6435  ModifyAllProjectToolbarMenus();
6436 
6437  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
6438 }
6439 
6440 void AudacityProject::OnAddLabel()
6441 {
6442  DoAddLabel(mViewInfo.selectedRegion);
6443 }
6444 
6445 void AudacityProject::OnAddLabelPlaying()
6446 {
6447  if (GetAudioIOToken()>0 &&
6448  gAudioIO->IsStreamActive(GetAudioIOToken())) {
6449  double indicator = gAudioIO->GetStreamTime();
6450  DoAddLabel(SelectedRegion(indicator, indicator), true);
6451  }
6452 }

6459 
6460  if (dlg.ShowModal() == wxID_OK) {
6461  PushState(_("Edited labels"), _("Label"));
6462  RedrawProject();
6463  }
6464 }

6478 
6479 void AudacityProject::OnRemoveTracks()
6480 {
6481  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
6482  Track *t = iter.First();
6483  Track *f = NULL;
6484  Track *l = NULL;
6485 
6486  while (t) {
6487  if (t->GetSelected()) {
6488  if (mMixerBoard && (t->GetKind() == Track::Wave))
6489  mMixerBoard->RemoveTrackCluster((WaveTrack*)t);
6490  if (!f)
6491  f = l; // Capture the track preceeding the first removed track
6492  t = iter.RemoveCurrent(true);
6493  }
6494  else {
6495  l = t;
6496  t = iter.Next();
6497  }
6498  }
6499 
6500  // All tracks but the last were removed...try to use the last track
6501  if (!f)
6502  f = l;
6503 
6504  // Try to use the first track after the removal or, if none,
6505  // the track preceeding the removal
6506  if (f) {
6507  t = mTracks->GetNext(f, true);
6508  if (t)
6509  f = t;
6510  }
6511 
6512  // If we actually have something left, then make sure it's seen
6513  if (f)
6514  mTrackPanel->EnsureVisible(f);
6515 
6516  PushState(_("Removed audio track(s)"), _("Remove Track"));
6517 
6518  mTrackPanel->UpdateViewIfNoTracks();
6519  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
6520 
6521  if (mMixerBoard)
6522  mMixerBoard->Refresh(true);
6523 }
6524

6526 // Help Menu
6527 //

6589 void AudacityProject::OnAudioDeviceInfo()
6590 {
6591  wxString info = gAudioIO->GetDeviceInfo();
6592 
6593  wxDialog dlg(this, wxID_ANY, wxString(_("Audio Device Info")));
6594  dlg.SetName(dlg.GetTitle());
6595  ShuttleGui S(&dlg, eIsCreating);
6596 
6597  wxTextCtrl *text;
6598  S.StartVerticalLay();
6599  {
6600  S.SetStyle(wxTE_MULTILINE | wxTE_READONLY);
6601  text = S.Id(wxID_STATIC).AddTextWindow(info);
6602  S.AddStandardButtons(eOkButton | eCancelButton);
6603  }
6604  S.EndVerticalLay();
6605 
6606  dlg.FindWindowById(wxID_OK)->SetLabel(_("&Save"));
6607  dlg.SetSize(350, 450);
6608 
6609  if (dlg.ShowModal() == wxID_OK)
6610  {
6611  wxString fName = FileSelector(_("Save Device Info"),
6612  wxEmptyString,
6613  wxT("deviceinfo.txt"),
6614  wxT("txt"),
6615  wxT("*.txt"),
6616  wxFD_SAVE | wxFD_OVERWRITE_PROMPT | wxRESIZE_BORDER,
6617  this);
6618  if (!fName.IsEmpty())
6619  {
6620  if (!text->SaveFile(fName))
6621  {
6622  wxMessageBox(_("Unable to save device info"), _("Save Device Info"));
6623  }
6624  }
6625  }
6626 }

6632 
6633 void AudacityProject::OnCollapseAllTracks()
6634 {
6635  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
6636  Track *t = iter.First();
6637 
6638  while (t)
6639  {
6640  t->SetMinimized(true);
6641  t = iter.Next();
6642  }
6643 
6644  ModifyState(true);
6645  RedrawProject();
6646 }
6647 
6648 void AudacityProject::OnExpandAllTracks()
6649 {
6650  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
6651  Track *t = iter.First();
6652 
6653  while (t)
6654  {
6655  t->SetMinimized(false);
6656  t = iter.Next();
6657  }
6658 
6659  ModifyState(true);
6660  RedrawProject();
6661 }
6662 
6663 
6664 void AudacityProject::OnMuteAllTracks()
6665 {
6666  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
6667  Track *t = iter.First();
6668 
6669  while (t)
6670  {
6671  if (t->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
6672  t->SetMute(true);
6673 
6674  t = iter.Next();
6675  }
6676 
6677  ModifyState(true);
6678  RedrawProject();
6679  if (mMixerBoard)
6680  mMixerBoard->UpdateMute();
6681 }
6682 
6683 void AudacityProject::OnUnMuteAllTracks()
6684 {
6685  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
6686  Track *t = iter.First();
6687 
6688  while (t)
6689  {
6690  t->SetMute(false);
6691  t = iter.Next();
6692  }
6693 
6694  ModifyState(true);
6695  RedrawProject();
6696  if (mMixerBoard)
6697  mMixerBoard->UpdateMute();
6698 }
6699 
6700 void AudacityProject::OnLockPlayRegion()
6701 {
6702  double start, end;
6703  GetPlayRegion(&start, &end);
6704  if (start >= mTracks->GetEndTime()) {
6705  wxMessageBox(_("Cannot lock region beyond\nend of project."),
6706  _("Error"));
6707  }
6708  else {
6709  mLockPlayRegion = true;
6710  mRuler->Refresh(false);
6711  }
6712 }
6713 
6714 void AudacityProject::OnUnlockPlayRegion()
6715 {
6716  mLockPlayRegion = false;
6717  mRuler->Refresh(false);
6718 }
6719 
6720 void AudacityProject::OnResample()
6721 {
6722  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
6723 
6724  int newRate;
6725 
6726  while (true)
6727  {
6728  wxDialog dlg(this, wxID_ANY, wxString(_("Resample")));
6729  dlg.SetName(dlg.GetTitle());
6730  ShuttleGui S(&dlg, eIsCreating);
6731  wxString rate;
6732  wxArrayString rates;
6733  wxComboBox *cb;
6734 
6735  rate.Printf(wxT("%ld"), lrint(mRate));
6736 
6737  rates.Add(wxT("8000"));
6738  rates.Add(wxT("11025"));
6739  rates.Add(wxT("16000"));
6740  rates.Add(wxT("22050"));
6741  rates.Add(wxT("32000"));
6742  rates.Add(wxT("44100"));
6743  rates.Add(wxT("48000"));
6744  rates.Add(wxT("88200"));
6745  rates.Add(wxT("96000"));
6746  rates.Add(wxT("176400"));
6747  rates.Add(wxT("192000"));
6748  rates.Add(wxT("352800"));
6749  rates.Add(wxT("384000"));
6750 
6751  S.StartVerticalLay(true);
6752  {
6753  S.AddSpace(-1, 15);
6754 
6755  S.StartHorizontalLay(wxCENTER, false);
6756  {
6757  cb = S.AddCombo(_("New sample rate (Hz):"),
6758  rate,
6759  &rates);
6760  }
6761  S.EndHorizontalLay();
6762 
6763  S.AddSpace(-1, 15);
6764 
6765  S.AddStandardButtons();
6766  }
6767  S.EndVerticalLay();
6768 
6769  dlg.Layout();
6770  dlg.Fit();
6771  dlg.Center();
6772 
6773  if (dlg.ShowModal() != wxID_OK)
6774  {
6775  return; // user cancelled dialog
6776  }
6777 
6778  long lrate;
6779  if (cb->GetValue().ToLong(&lrate) && lrate >= 1 && lrate <= 1000000)
6780  {
6781  newRate = (int)lrate;
6782  break;
6783  }
6784 
6785  wxMessageBox(_("The entered value is invalid"), _("Error"),
6786  wxICON_ERROR, this);
6787  }
6788 
6789  int ndx = 0;
6790  for (Track *t = iter.First(); t; t = iter.Next())
6791  {
6792  wxString msg;
6793 
6794  msg.Printf(_("Resampling track %d"), ++ndx);
6795 
6796  ProgressDialog progress(_("Resample"), msg);
6797 
6798  if (t->GetSelected() && t->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
6799  if (!((WaveTrack*)t)->Resample(newRate, &progress))
6800  break;
6801  }
6802 
6803  PushState(_("Resampled audio track(s)"), _("Resample Track"));
6804  RedrawProject();
6805 
6806  // Need to reset
6807  FinishAutoScroll();
6808 }
6809 
6810 void AudacityProject::OnSnapToOff()
6811 {
6812  SetSnapTo(SNAP_OFF);
6813 }

6816 {
6817  SetSnapTo(SNAP_NEAREST);

6821 {
6822  SetSnapTo(SNAP_PRIOR);
6823 }

6825 void AudacityProject::OnFullScreen()
6826 {

6828  wxTopLevelWindow::ShowFullScreen(false);
6829  else
6830  wxTopLevelWindow::ShowFullScreen(true);
6831 }
6832 
6833 void AudacityProject::OnCursorLeft(bool shift, bool ctrl, bool keyup)
6834 {
6835  // PRL: What I found and preserved, strange though it be:
6836  // During playback: jump depends on preferences and is independent of the zoom
6837  // and does not vary if the key is held
6838  // Else: jump depends on the zoom and gets bigger if the key is held
6839  int snapToTime = GetSnapTo();
6840  double quietSeekStepPositive = 1.0; // pixels
6841  double audioSeekStepPositive = shift ? mSeekLong : mSeekShort;
6842  SeekLeftOrRight
6843  (true, shift, ctrl, keyup, snapToTime, true, false,
6844  quietSeekStepPositive, true,
6845  audioSeekStepPositive, false);
6846 }
6847 
6848 void AudacityProject::OnCursorRight(bool shift, bool ctrl, bool keyup)
6849 {
6850  // PRL: What I found and preserved, strange though it be:
6851  // During playback: jump depends on preferences and is independent of the zoom
6852  // and does not vary if the key is held
6853  // Else: jump depends on the zoom and gets bigger if the key is held
6854  int snapToTime = GetSnapTo();
6855  double quietSeekStepPositive = 1.0; // pixels
6856  double audioSeekStepPositive = shift ? mSeekLong : mSeekShort;
6857  SeekLeftOrRight
6858  (false, shift, ctrl, keyup, snapToTime, true, false,
6859  quietSeekStepPositive, true,
6860  audioSeekStepPositive, false);
6861 }
6862 
6863 // Handle small cursor and play head movements
6864 void AudacityProject::SeekLeftOrRight
6865 (bool leftward, bool shift, bool ctrl, bool keyup,
6866  int snapToTime, bool mayAccelerateQuiet, bool mayAccelerateAudio,
6867  double quietSeekStepPositive, bool quietStepIsPixels,
6868  double audioSeekStepPositive, bool audioStepIsPixels)
6869 {
6870  if (keyup)
6871  {
6872  if (IsAudioActive())
6873  {
6874  return;
6875  }
6876 
6877  ModifyState(false);
6878  return;
6879  }
6880 
6881  // If the last adjustment was very recent, we are
6882  // holding the key down and should move faster.
6883  const wxLongLong curtime = ::wxGetLocalTimeMillis();
6884  enum { MIN_INTERVAL = 50 };
6885  const bool fast = (curtime - mLastSelectionAdjustment < MIN_INTERVAL);
6886 
6887  // How much faster should the cursor move if shift is down?
6888  enum { LARGER_MULTIPLIER = 4 };
6889  int multiplier = (fast && mayAccelerateQuiet) ? LARGER_MULTIPLIER : 1;
6890  if (leftward)
6891  multiplier = -multiplier;
6892 
6893  if (shift && ctrl)
6894  {
6895  mLastSelectionAdjustment = curtime;
6896 
6897  // Contract selection
6898  // Reduce and constrain (counter-intuitive)
6899  if (leftward) {
6900  const double t1 = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1();
6901  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT1(
6902  std::max(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
6903  snapToTime
6904  ? GridMove(t1, multiplier)
6905  : quietStepIsPixels
6906  ? mViewInfo.OffsetTimeByPixels(
6907  t1, int(multiplier * quietSeekStepPositive))
6908  : t1 + multiplier * quietSeekStepPositive
6909  ));
6910 
6911  // Make sure it's visible.
6912  GetTrackPanel()->ScrollIntoView(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
6913  }
6914  else {
6915  const double t0 = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0();
6916  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT0(
6917  std::min(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1(),
6918  snapToTime
6919  ? GridMove(t0, multiplier)
6920  : quietStepIsPixels
6921  ? mViewInfo.OffsetTimeByPixels(
6922  t0, int(multiplier * quietSeekStepPositive))
6923  : t0 + multiplier * quietSeekStepPositive
6924  ));
6925 
6926  // Make sure NEW position is in view.
6927  GetTrackPanel()->ScrollIntoView(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0());
6928  }
6929  GetTrackPanel()->Refresh(false);
6930  }
6931  else if (IsAudioActive()) {
6932 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_IMPROVED_SEEKING
6933  if (gAudioIO->GetLastPlaybackTime() < mLastSelectionAdjustment) {
6934  // Allow time for the last seek to output a buffer before
6935  // discarding samples again
6936  // Do not advance mLastSelectionAdjustment
6937  return;
6938  }
6939 #endif
6940  mLastSelectionAdjustment = curtime;
6941 
6942  // Ignore the multiplier for the quiet case
6943  multiplier = (fast && mayAccelerateAudio) ? LARGER_MULTIPLIER : 1;
6944  if (leftward)
6945  multiplier = -multiplier;
6946 
6947  // If playing, reposition
6948  double seconds;
6949  if (audioStepIsPixels) {
6950  const double streamTime = gAudioIO->GetStreamTime();
6951  const double newTime =
6952  mViewInfo.OffsetTimeByPixels(streamTime, int(audioSeekStepPositive));
6953  seconds = newTime - streamTime;
6954  }
6955  else
6956  seconds = multiplier * audioSeekStepPositive;
6957  gAudioIO->SeekStream(seconds);
6958  return;
6959  }
6960  else if (shift)
6961  {
6962  mLastSelectionAdjustment = curtime;
6963 
6964  // Extend selection
6965  // Expand and constrain
6966  if (leftward) {
6967  const double t0 = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0();
6968  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT0(
6969  std::max(0.0,
6970  snapToTime
6971  ? GridMove(t0, multiplier)
6972  : quietStepIsPixels
6973  ? mViewInfo.OffsetTimeByPixels(
6974  t0, int(multiplier * quietSeekStepPositive))
6975  : t0 + multiplier * quietSeekStepPositive
6976  ));
6977 
6978  // Make sure it's visible.
6979  GetTrackPanel()->ScrollIntoView(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0());
6980  }
6981  else {
6982  const double end = mTracks->GetEndTime();
6983  const double t1 = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1();
6984  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT1(
6985  std::min(end,
6986  snapToTime
6987  ? GridMove(t1, multiplier)
6988  : quietStepIsPixels
6989  ? mViewInfo.OffsetTimeByPixels(
6990  t1, int(multiplier * quietSeekStepPositive))
6991  : t1 + multiplier * quietSeekStepPositive
6992  ));
6993 
6994  // Make sure NEW position is in view.
6995  GetTrackPanel()->ScrollIntoView(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
6996  }
6997  GetTrackPanel()->Refresh(false);
6998  }
6999  else
7000  {
7001  mLastSelectionAdjustment = curtime;
7002 
7003  // Move the cursor
7004  // Already in cursor mode?
7005  if (mViewInfo.selectedRegion.isPoint())
7006  {
7007  // Move and constrain
7008  const double end = mTracks->GetEndTime();
7009  const double t0 = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0();
7010  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT0(
7011  std::max(0.0,
7012  std::min(end,
7013  snapToTime
7014  ? GridMove(t0, multiplier)
7015  : quietStepIsPixels
7016  ? mViewInfo.OffsetTimeByPixels(
7017  t0, int(multiplier * quietSeekStepPositive))
7018  : t0 + multiplier * quietSeekStepPositive)),
7019  false // do not swap selection boundaries
7020  );
7021  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.collapseToT0();
7022 
7023  // Move the visual cursor, avoiding an unnecessary complete redraw
7024  GetTrackPanel()->DrawOverlays(false);
7025  }
7026  else
7027  {
7028  // Transition to cursor mode.
7029  if (leftward)
7030  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.collapseToT0();
7031  else
7032  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.collapseToT1();
7033  GetTrackPanel()->Refresh(false);
7034  }
7035 
7036  // Make sure NEW position is in view
7037  GetTrackPanel()->ScrollIntoView(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
7038  }
7039 }
7040 
7041 // Handles moving a selection edge with the keyboard in snap-to-time mode;
7042 // returns the moved value.
7043 // Will move at least minPix pixels -- set minPix positive to move forward,
7044 // negative to move backward.
7045 double AudacityProject::GridMove(double t, int minPix)
7046 {
7047  NumericConverter nc(NumericConverter::TIME, GetSelectionFormat(), t, GetRate());
7048 
7049  // Try incrementing/decrementing the value; if we've moved far enough we're
7050  // done
7051  double result;
7052  minPix >= 0 ? nc.Increment() : nc.Decrement();
7053  result = nc.GetValue();
7054  if (std::abs(mViewInfo.TimeToPosition(result) - mViewInfo.TimeToPosition(t))
7055  >= abs(minPix))
7056  return result;
7057 
7058  // Otherwise, move minPix pixels, then snap to the time.
7059  result = mViewInfo.OffsetTimeByPixels(t, minPix);
7060  nc.SetValue(result);
7061  result = nc.GetValue();
7062  return result;
7063 }
7064 
7065 void AudacityProject::OnBoundaryMove(bool left, bool boundaryContract)
7066 {
7067  // Move the left/right selection boundary, to either expand or contract the selection
7068  // left=true: operate on left boundary; left=false: operate on right boundary
7069  // boundaryContract=true: contract region; boundaryContract=false: expand region.
7070 
7071  // If the last adjustment was very recent, we are
7072  // holding the key down and should move faster.
7073  wxLongLong curtime = ::wxGetLocalTimeMillis();
7074  int pixels = 1;
7075  if( curtime - mLastSelectionAdjustment < 50 )
7076  {
7077  pixels = 4;
7078  }
7079  mLastSelectionAdjustment = curtime;
7080 
7081  if (IsAudioActive())
7082  {
7083  double indicator = gAudioIO->GetStreamTime();
7084  if (left)
7085  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT0(indicator, false);
7086  else
7087  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT1(indicator);
7088 
7089  ModifyState(false);
7090  GetTrackPanel()->Refresh(false);
7091  }
7092  else
7093  {
7094  // BOUNDARY MOVEMENT
7095  // Contract selection from the right to the left
7096  if( boundaryContract )
7097  {
7098  if (left) {
7099  // Reduce and constrain left boundary (counter-intuitive)
7100  // Move the left boundary by at most the desired number of pixels,
7101  // but not past the right
7102  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT0(
7103  std::min(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1(),
7104  mViewInfo.OffsetTimeByPixels(
7105  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
7106  pixels)));
7107 
7108  // Make sure it's visible
7109  GetTrackPanel()->ScrollIntoView(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0());
7110  }
7111  else
7112  {
7113  // Reduce and constrain right boundary (counter-intuitive)
7114  // Move the right boundary by at most the desired number of pixels,
7115  // but not past the left
7116  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT1(
7117  std::max(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
7118  mViewInfo.OffsetTimeByPixels(
7119  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1(),
7120  -pixels)));
7121 
7122  // Make sure it's visible
7123  GetTrackPanel()->ScrollIntoView(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
7124  }
7125  }
7126  // BOUNDARY MOVEMENT
7127  // Extend selection toward the left
7128  else
7129  {
7130  if (left) {
7131  // Expand and constrain left boundary
7132  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT0(
7133  std::max(0.0,
7134  mViewInfo.OffsetTimeByPixels(
7135  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
7136  -pixels)));
7137 
7138  // Make sure it's visible
7139  GetTrackPanel()->ScrollIntoView(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0());
7140  }
7141  else
7142  {
7143  // Expand and constrain right boundary
7144  const double end = mTracks->GetEndTime();
7145  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT1(
7146  std::min(end,
7147  mViewInfo.OffsetTimeByPixels(
7148  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1(),
7149  pixels)));
7150 
7151  // Make sure it's visible
7152  GetTrackPanel()->ScrollIntoView(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
7153  }
7154  }
7155  GetTrackPanel()->Refresh( false );
7156  ModifyState(false);
7157  }
7158 }
7159 
7160 // Move the cursor forward or backward, while paused or while playing.
7161 // forward=true: Move cursor forward; forward=false: Move cursor backwards
7162 // jump=false: Move cursor determined by zoom; jump=true: Use seek times
7163 // longjump=false: Use mSeekShort; longjump=true: Use mSeekLong
7164 void AudacityProject::OnCursorMove(bool forward, bool jump, bool longjump )
7165 {
7166  // PRL: nobody calls this yet with !jump
7167 
7168  double positiveSeekStep;
7169  bool byPixels;
7170  if (jump) {
7171  if (!longjump) {
7172  positiveSeekStep = mSeekShort;
7173  } else {
7174  positiveSeekStep = mSeekLong;
7175  }
7176  byPixels = false;
7177  } else {
7178  positiveSeekStep = 1.0;
7179  byPixels = true;
7180  }
7181  bool mayAccelerate = !jump;
7182  SeekLeftOrRight
7183  (!forward, false, false, false,
7184  0, mayAccelerate, mayAccelerate,
7185  positiveSeekStep, byPixels,
7186  positiveSeekStep, byPixels);
7187 
7188  ModifyState(false);
7189 }
